texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Oi, where did Will go?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We went to get some salt upstairs. He is taking long, isn't he?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Maybe he's lazying around?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We're closing already, so it's the same, but why is Will resting while I'm busting my arse here?
I grab the closed sign and walk to the entrance.
But then...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh...

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Huh? Oh...
A woman walks into the pub.
There's something familiar about her.
I stare at her face for a moment.
She gives me a small, timid smile.
I remember that smile.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're...
The woman from that night.
The one I crossed paths with on my way to the manor.
It's definitely her.
I just know it.
A rush of joy courses through me.
Ever since then, I've been curious about what kind of person she is.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Are you alone?
She nods.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Are you okay with a bar seat? Please, come in.
I watch the woman as she walks to the counter.
She's no ordinary person.
I realize that straight away.
That's the gait of a person who stands upon the stage.
Her movements are so graceful and ingrained that they blend into her everyday motions.
It's something only another actor would notice.
I want it.
I want her in my troupe.
Holding back my excitement, I go behind the counter.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What would you like to drink? I'll join you. We ladies should enjoy a cup or two together.
Still silent, the woman points to a bottle of aqua vitae on the shelf.
It's a strong spirit that we recently got in stock.
She gracefully places a shilling on the counter.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You want to buy the whole bottle?
She nods.
She manages to make even that nod look like the most beautiful thing.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I see you have good taste. Well then.
I take two glasses and pour the thick tawny liquid into them.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Say, why don't we play a game? Whoever can drink the other under the counter has to do whatever the winner says.
The woman's eyes glimmer with a mysterious light when I say that.
A smile touches her lips.
It seems like she finds the idea amusing.
She takes her glass and raises it in front of me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: To our meeting tonight.
We clink our glasses together.
The hard spirit burns its way down my throat.
It's stronger than I expected.
I try to remember the number of cups of ale I shared with customers today.
I stopped counting at some point.
If I knew this was gonna happen, I would have stayed sober.
I feel the tension mounting in me after the first drink.
I take short, shallow breaths so the heat doesn't show in my face.
The woman is already waiting for a refill, her glass set on the counter.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Heheh, talk about an elegant way to pick a quarrel.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: This is not a quarrel, and I'd appreciate it if you kept your comments to yourself.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Hey, Olivia! You're not looking so good, lass!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'll sew your mouth shut!
By the time I lose count of how many cups we've shared, my stomach is ready to regurgitate everything I forced into it.
But I manage to suppress the impulse somehow.
I'm at my limit.
I can't control my breathing either.
My breaths feel warm and damp.
To think there's a woman alive who can drink more than me!
No...
If I was sober, it wouldn't even have been a contest.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You are...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...pretty good.
Olivia's eyes are still steady.
I drain the liquor poured into my glass.
When I put it down back to the counter, some liquid still remains in Olivia's glass.
I smile, snatch that glass, and drink the remaining liquor in it.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ah...
Olivia's face is a mix of bewilderment and frustration.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...I get it, I lost. I'm amazed by how much you can drink, truly.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And you're so beautiful... Please, would you tell me your name?
I stare right into her eyes.
I can't take it anymore.
I burst into laughter right in front of her face.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Huh?
Her eyes bulge out in absolute astonishment.
Rob freezes in his seat as realization dawns upon him.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't think I need to give my name, do I?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Oh, Lord...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will?
I nod cheerfully.
For a moment, joy and excitement flicker across her face.
...Only to be replaced by absolute rage and an inferno in her eyes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ah...
Olivia raises her right arm slowly.
And delivers the strongest slap yet, directly to my face.
It takes but a second for the pain to spread throughout my skull.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Wh-What was that for?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You impertinent little runt!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You, a bloody slave! How dare you deceive me! How dare you!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Ahahahah!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: What? What's happening?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Hear this, Boss! Thought we had a real beauty here, but they turned out to be your son!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: What in the world do you mean, Rob?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Exactly what I said, ahahah!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You impertinent runt... Impudent rascal! You're my slave!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But... But....

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That was splendid, Will. Well done, you performed most magnificently...

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: And she's wasted.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hahah, this is new.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I wasn't joking when I said I wouldn't have lost if I was sober last time.
I lay my hand on her head where it rests on the counter.
It's surprisingly petite, I notice.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Ah, those are the clothes you asked me for, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, you didn't notice?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: I didn't even look at them. Don't have any business looking at women's clothing.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: My boy, are you crossdressing?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Ahahah! How I wish my eyes could see this!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Boss, his beauty is no laughing matter, I tell you!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: It's like we have two Olivias in here.
I feel a bitter smile creep up on my face.
That would only make sense.
I stole from Olivia to create this woman.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Ahahahah! This only gets better and better! Are you embarrassed, son?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It was embarrassing at first. But our troupe has to beat Marlowe, and this is what I need to do.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I can't afford to let myself be frozen into inaction by embarrassment.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Heh...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And...
I turn to Olivia, who's sleeping soundly, facedown on the counter.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia has done nothing but help me since the day we met. I want to live up to her expectations at least once.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: I see now.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: I don't even feel like making banter about it now, boohoo. Time to pour myself a drink.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Serve one for me too, good man!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Not a chance in hell, Boss! You stay put!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Curses...
I lay the drunk Olivia on my bed and go to my desk.
I can hear her peaceful, even breathing.
I stare at her for a moment.
Peacefully asleep like this, she looks like an entirely different person.
It reminds me of watching my mother sleep in that same bed when I was a child.
The script for Hamlet lies on top of my desk.
His revenge is the mouthpiece for my anger.
And now, he's aiming that anger against his own mother.
I feel like something's off.
The ghost of his father.
His uncle, who stole his mother from him.
And Hamlet himself.
I don't feel like the mother should be at the center of this revenge story.
But that same mother decided to start sleeping with the brother of her husband immediately following his death.
Surely Hamlet would see that as the weakness of women manifested in her.
But...
"Being able to recognize your weakness is the first step in forgiving weakness in others."
I remember Ed's words.
I feel like I finally understand what he meant by that now.
Yes, Hamlet's obsessive self-questioning lays all his weaknesses bare.
And at the end...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: He... forgives her?
His dead father.
Murdered by his own uncle.
He wants revenge for this injustice.
It's simple.
And in that mad rush for vengeance, his mother ends up dead.
But that wasn't what he wanted.
A sliver of forgiveness dwelt inside his heart.
And that... is the biggest of tragedies.
The deadline is creeping up on me.
And the person who imposed that unreasonable deadline is snoring away on my bed right now.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No rest for the wicked, I guess.
I mutter to myself as I let my quill flow across the paper.
Next morning.
Leaving Olivia to sleep, I go downstairs to arrange the chairs in the pub before taking a nap.
I wake up feeling faint aches here and there.
And here I thought I had completely healed from that savage beating the watchmen gave me.
A wry smile on my face, I get up, slip behind the counter, and begin doing the morning prep.
After a while, I hear the steps of someone coming down the stairs.
It's Olivia, the color strangely drained from her face.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Good morning. How are you feeling?
She stares at me, her breathing ragged.
Her pale complexion could be due to a hangover.
Maybe her blood flow isn't so good.
But somehow, I feel like that's not the whole story.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...What time is it?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh? Almost noon, I think?
Olivia frowns, and her expression hardens.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you still mad at me? I know it was sneaky of me to deceive you, but I—

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm leaving. I can't help you with prep today, sorry.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?
Olivia walks to the door at a swift pace and throws it open.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hey! What about rehearsal?!
By the time the words leave my mouth, she's already gone.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What's her problem?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Hah, hah...
I was careless.
I relaxed my guard completely.
I always have to be back before Spencer finishes having his fun for the night.
And just when I finally saw a flicker of hope for the troupe.
How could I have endured so scrupulously up until today...
Only to slip and fall now?
My head is throbbing.
The drinks from yesterday pool heavily in my stomach.
I can smell them on my breath.
But there's no time for me to wait to sober up completely.
Maybe Spencer decided to play around until noon today.
I can but hope that's the case.
I run down the streets to the manor while pulling up my messy hair and tying it into a ponytail.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Hah, hah...
Stepping into the entryway, I take a minute to get my breath back.
A butler comes over with a cloth, and I use it to wipe my sweat.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Is Lord Spencer in his room?
The butler nods.
I bite my lower lip in frustration.
I didn't make it in time.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Okay, thank you.
I take a deep breath and head to his room.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Hmm? Who goes there?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Olivia. May I enter?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Ah, Olive. Esta bien, come in.
Upon entering, I see Spencer lying on the bed with a woman and a man snuggling up against him on each side.
They're all undressed.
The scent gives it away.
He bought these two last night, and has been indulging in them the whole night long.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I am terribly sorry. I failed to perform my duties this morning.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Yes, you certainly did.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: It's fine. This chico and chica kept me company in your stead.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: It was quite pleasurable indeed. Especially this chico's little amigo...
Spencer reaches out to the handsome man on his left, pure ecstasy lacing his smile.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm glad to see you're enjoying yourself, my Lord.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Olive, I hear you're outside the manor a lot these days.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Yes. I am focused on being selected for the court's performance, so all my time is going into theatrical training.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Your breath stinks.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I am terribly sorry. I drank a little too much with the other troupe members.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Drinking is fine, the problema arises when you stand before me completely drunk. Too much is too much, little Olive.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I will be more careful from now on.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I will forgive you, since I myself let my sentidos become drunk on these two. But there will be no mercy next time, are we in agreement?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I understand very well.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Okay, then this conversation is over. Aah, but one more thing. I have decided on an abode in the Nuevo Mundo.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I will journey there this coming autumn. I will need to make new connections in social gatherings, thus I will need an esposa. You know where I'm going with this?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Yes.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Do make up your mind while there's tiempo. It will be meaningless if I don't own you while there is still beauty in you. Let one wrinkle appear on that linda face of yours, and I will dispose of you like the refuse you are, understood?
I bow silently.
Then I proceed to leave the room swiftly.
I can hear Spencer's lascivious moans from the other side of the door.
He must still be trying to satiate that inexhaustible desire of his with those two.
A sigh leaves my lips.
My head is still above my shoulders, at least for now.
But nothing has been solved, not really.
There is only one way out for me.
To be selected for the court performance, show our ability, and be put under the patronage of the Royal Household.
If I am to continue acting...
I will have to speak into the ear of the Queen and influence the Royal Household, so that the laws themselves can be changed.
I have no other choice.
Now that we're being ruled by a Queen who is sympathetic towards theater, this is my chance.
After finishing getting ready, I head to the theater.
Olivia is there before me, and rehearsal starts as per usual, but...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Stop! Will, you're good. You've improved a great deal. Thomas, Kiki, your performances are abhorrent!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I struggle to find anything more crude and vulgar than seeing you flapping about on stage!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kiki, Helena has never wanted for food. She may not be popular with men, but it's not like she was raised in a barn.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, ma'am...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: She's not a petty thief like you, so try to act the part!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, ma'am...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You too, Thomas. Puck the fairy may be shrewd, but he's not evil.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Have you seen yourself in a mirror? You look like wickedness itself put on clothes and started walking around.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yes, ma'am...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You need to change your very way of life. Acting is not a bloody game! It's too late for you to pretend you're something else, so change your life instead.

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: Yes, ma'am...
Her orders are more nonsensical and erratic than before.
Her face is still pale, and her breath still stinks of alcohol if you're close enough.
Sometimes she puts a hand to her head, no doubt nursing a headache.
It feels like she's lashing out with her anger at the rest of the troupe members.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Your movements are good, they catch the eye. They fit with the overall flow of the scenes and don't disrupt them, though I would expect that from the play's author.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Practice your lines a little more. Keep imitating me if that's what you're going for.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It'd be good if you could make your voice a little higher, but try not to overdo it.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It'll get easier with practice.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All right.
Surprisingly, her advice to me is far more constructive.
It looks like she's capable of giving meaningful advice to those who surpass her standards.
The problem, as I see it, is that those standards are too high.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We'll take a five minute break. When we're done, let's start this scene again from the top.
No one says anything.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Understood?!

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: Yes, ma'am.
I chase after Olivia as she walks backstage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What?
Her rose irises shine from her narrowed eyes.
Managing not to falter in the face of her piercing gaze, I voice my request.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Can I sit and watch the rehearsal today?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're not gonna participate?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why not? I know you've improved a fair bit, but you already took plenty time off when you got hurt.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're already healed from that, aren't you? Are you hungover?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, I just want to see the troupe as a whole perform.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I want to see them as fully and objectively as possible from a distance. It's impossible to see everything properly while on the stage.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What for?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We barely have any time until the premiere. What's gonna happen if things keep going as they are right now? I'm sure you're aware nothing good's gonna come of this.
Olivia sighs while holding her head.
Looks like hangovers hit her hard.
I know that pain well myself.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Just for today, then. Otherwise the rest of the troupe might try to pull the same move as an excuse to skip out on rehearsals.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That will be enough. Thanks.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Just try to actually come up with something useful from it, understood?
After the break, I move back from the group to a distance where I can watch them perform as a whole.
As always, Olivia's watching in front of the stage, instructing everyone about their movements.
If there's anything that deviates from her instructions, she stops the practice on the spot.
The member that made the mistake is thoroughly scolded, while the others simply stare into the distance with vacant eyes.
When she gets mad at Thomas, his eyes meet Kiki's and he makes a flippant gesture with his hand.
For a moment, I shudder.
But Olivia seems oblivious as she keeps shouting in his face.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I see.
She finishes grilling Thomas after a while.
He seems to have internalized the movements Olivia instructed, in his own way.
After a long pause, they resume the rehearsal.
Not from the beginning, but from the point where she stopped them.
They can't possibly memorize the flow of the scene after an interruption like that.
I try connecting the first half with the second in my head.
It's all messed up even for me, so I imagine it must be worse for them.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Stop! Kiki! You're all over the place! Come here!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, ma'am.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Heheh, serves you right.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Goodness.
The rehearsal is over, and the rest of the troupe leaves with sagged shoulders and tired expressions.
Rather than relief at it being over, they all seem to be weighed down by the fact that they'll have to endure the same thing all over again tomorrow.
...The play's supposed to be a comedy, mind you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So, how did it look from afar? Learn anything?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah. Many things, in fact.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You don't say.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's talk at the pub. We still have time before we open up.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The first thing I learned is that if things continue this way, we don't have a hope of beating Marlowe come premiere day.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's not about each actor as an individual; we're not organized as a group.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So?
Olivia's staring into my eyes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Right now, most of the rehearsal time is eaten away by you scolding anyone that makes a mistake.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Not that your guidance isn't helping them.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: There is always visible change in the members that you scold. That's quite remarkable.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I do have experience dealing with rebellious slaves. How ironic.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, ironic indeed.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Currently, the person who needs to change their attitude the most is...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...you, Olivia.
Her rose eyes flare with anger and indignation.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ironic, isn't it?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: For your own well being, I hope this is not just some joke at my expense.
I shake my head.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Explain yourself.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let me go through some points. First of all, the way you're going about things right now is woefully inefficient.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Do you remember how many full scenes we rehearsed today?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And it's not just today. It's been this way ever since the scripts were handed out. The only time we've been able to make it to the last line...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...was during the first group reading.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But there are mistakes that can't be overlooked! I have no choice but to stop them!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's exchange putting on a play for making clothes, and think of it from that perspective.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Right now, you're fussing over the placement of every single button on your blouse.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: God is in the details. Isn't that a saying you bards like to invoke?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But we haven't even started to work on the trousers! No matter how perfectly placed the buttons on your blouse are, everyone will laugh if you go out in your knickers!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: In fact, the more beautiful the buttons are, the more ridiculous the whole situation appears.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I've had it with your damn analogies! Move on!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No matter how ill-fitting or dirty the clothes we wear are, we must first be fully clothed before we can even step onto the stage.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I get what you're saying. Now tell me your solution.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We need time to run through the whole rehearsal without any interruptions. At the beginning of the day and at the end.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: With this play, I think we can manage it. For scripts with longer acts, they can be separated by curtain calls.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: During the intermissions between acts, you can come in. You can grill them relentlessly for their mistakes as much as you want, just like always.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: As things stand, I'll have to memorize so many things to point out that my head will explode.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You truly are an armchair critic, huh? Your ideas must sound so easy and obvious in your head.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's agree on a simple sign you can make for me to look out for. I'll remember for you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I will have at least a hundred corrections to remember.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll memorize them all. I promise.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Can you truly do such a thing?
I nod.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm confident. Let's at least give it a try.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Suit yourself.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You still have more to say?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You're stunting the troupe members with your criticism. It's fine if you have to force yourself to do it, but please look for something good in each person's performance and praise them for it.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What?! Why must I be mindful of the egos of you bunch of rabble?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Because you're the leader of this troupe.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Then why don't they try obeying orders and acting as I instruct them to?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You're talking about what a slave would do.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Same thing! Why, you're all my bloody slaves!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Even if that's true, I think you should forget that during rehearsals.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why would I do such a thing?! Slaves get no rest!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Does the audience come to see a troupe of slaves? I don't think so, do you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If there is no trust between the leader of the troupe and the actors, it'll all be for naught. Do you want the troupe to be chosen for the court performance or not?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Do you want to whip slaves, or do you want to train actors? Think twice before answering that.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I've had enough of sitting here and hearing you prattle on and on.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I think you've interjected quite a lot, actually.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Silence!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Trust, you say? Don't make me laugh! Do you think I don't know what all of them whisper behind my back?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: If they want bloody trust, then how about they show themselves deserving of it first?! Do not demand what you don't give!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I could say those exact same words to you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ngh!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's just give it a try tomorrow, please.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You want to do this for the last showing of the Jew of Malta, right? We have no time to lose.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I won't stand for this!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Stand for what?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You spouting rhetoric with that smug look on your face! I won't stand for you making me look like the irrational one here!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Besides, how many times have you called me by name today?! Did you forget your due respect?! It's Lady Olivia to you!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I forgot.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: This is my bloody troupe! I will decide how we rehearse, and no one else! Don't get ahead of yourself.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Okay, what do you want to do?
Olivia's breathing is ragged, and her lips quiver from all the shouting.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Let's try the method you suggested.
Olivia murmurs, each word physically paining her.
After we close up the pub, I go upstairs to keep working on Hamlet's script.
I can see the end already in sight.
Hamlet's revenge tragedy begins from a dialogue with the ghost of his father.
He plays the part of a madman while he plots his revenge.
But the feigned madness gets a hold of him and consumes him. The line between sanity and madness blurs.
He keeps questioning his sanity, but no answer is awarded to him.
In the end, he loses both his mother and the woman he loved.
And he himself is dragged to the eternal sleep.
Hamlet is me.
The parts of myself that want revenge.
But...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Your death shan't be in vain.
This tragedy is indeed worth telling.
Someone has to tell this story.
For all those souls across the country that burn with the fire of hatred and the need for revenge, just like me.
At death's door...
Hamlet entrusts it all to a friend.
So that no one else repeats his selfsame mistakes.
If you let yourself be consumed by revenge, you will lose sight of what matters most.
That's why the closing line will be...
Thou livest; report me and my cause aright. In this harsh world draw thy breath in pain, to tell my story. Of carnal, bloody, and unnatural acts, of deaths put on by cunning and forced cause.
I cannot live to hear the News from England. On you, he has my dying voice.
The rest, is silence...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Starting today, we'll be changing up how we do these rehearsals.
At the start of the next day's rehearsal, Olivia addresses the troupe.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will, you explain.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Err, why me?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: This is your bright idea, is it not? Explain it yourself.
Olivia says as she takes a step back.
Everyone's eyes are on me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: So when we run through the play at the beginning and end of the day, the leader won't stop us in the middle of a scene, even if we make a mistake?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Even if we fumble our lines? Even if we move wrong?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Exactly. I just want you to focus on performing the full scenes until the end.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Are you serious?!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: We won't get yelled at even if we mess up?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Just remember that when the scene is over, she'll go over all the mistakes and correct you.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Almost had me there for a second. Go over mistakes? We're gonna get yelled at again.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: We're still gonna get grilled at the end.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Of course. What's the point of rehearsal if you don't get told what to improve upon?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Understood?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, ma'am.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You too.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yes, ma'am.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Well, it's better than feeling like you're walking on eggshells the whole time. I want to see how the play comes together as a whole.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Lady Olivia wants to see how it comes together, I mean.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Oh well, we're just here to do as we're told.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: If that's what you want, we'll do it.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yeah, let's get it out of the way.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Okay, if everyone's on the same page, let's begin.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah.
Now, this approach is supposed to help us visualize exactly what we're working with...

texts.name: Hermia
texts.text: ...Hey, Lysander.

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Hermia
texts.text: Say your line.

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: There, gentle Hermia, my love for thee is eternal! May I marry thee?

texts.name: Hermia
texts.text: My good Lysander! I swear to thee, by Cupid's strongest bow. To-morrow truly will I meet with thine, and our eternal will become!

texts.name: Puck
texts.text: Phew, that's one pair down.

texts.name: Helena
texts.text: Ah, Demetrius. Finally, my love for thee has made thee see the light!

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: Good morrow, friends. Saint Valentine is past. Perhaps we were blessed with everlasting love by the summer's court over this midsummer night.

texts.name: Helena
texts.text: Oh, Demetrius. Ne'er leave my side once more!

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: Let us go, Hermia. Before the morrow our vows will be sealed!

texts.name: Hermia
texts.text: Y-Yes, my love!

texts.name: Puck
texts.text: Why, then, finally all are awake! No more yielding but a dream, a gift, they say! Truly, all they did was have a silly midsummer night's dream! Courtesy of yours truly!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...So, this is the end, right?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Maybe?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: A break... We need a break. Will, you remember everything, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Y-Yeah.
Last night we agreed on a signal for her to make.
She used it liberally during the performance.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Prepare yourselves. I will thoroughly whip you into shape even if it takes me until morning. Understood?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Oh no...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Are we gonna be okay?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'd say this is a big step for her. Not jumping on every single mistake she sees and all.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You think so? She was shivering with barely repressed anger just now, I think.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Her face looked like a tomato and all.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Well, at least we got through the whole thing to the end. Baby steps.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Never have I seen such a vulgar fairy before! Fix it right now!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yes, ma'am.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kiki! Could your delivery get more deadpan?! Would it kill you to try to put some feeling into your lines?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And you're too short!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Err, not much I can do about that. I drink my milk every day, but it doesn't make much difference.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't talk back!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, ma'am.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This is a mess...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Your eyes are red, Will! You need to sleep! And I can still hear a boyish tone in your lines!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I can't sleep because you told me to—

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Shut up! Everything's wrong! Absolutely everything!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ah, can I say something too?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What?!
All the troupe members turn their anxious gazes on me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Generally speaking, it's bad. Pretty damn bad. I can admit that.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But I've realized some things.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Perhaps the way you point out mistakes isn't the most constructive. Maybe you could stand to improve your approach.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Why would you pour oil onto the pyre?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, do enlighten me. But do know that I'll have you torn apart limb from limb if I don't like what you have to say.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: In my scene, when Hermia and Lysander elope and spend the night in the forest.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Remember what you told me about Hermia?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Do you understand? Hermia has stood against her father for the first time. This naive, noble maiden has left her house to spend the night in the woods to be together with her beloved!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: She spends the night fretting over whether he'll hold her in his arms and return her love! She has never felt this strongly in her whole life! And, at dawn, this man tells her that he loves another woman!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This is the first night she's spent outside her parents' home. You said she was a maiden assaulted by a mixture of expectation and anxiety over whether the man she loves will take her or not.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Do you remember?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I do. Your point?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If you look at this scene on its own, that's how it appears. And that certainly adds to its feel as a human drama.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But this is a comedy, is it not? If we try to emphasize that angle, won't Hermia look a little too pitiful to the audience?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: In other words, if we want to take into account how this scene contributes to the general flow of the play overall...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Maybe it'd be better if we didn't focus the performance on her conflicted feelings, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It may come across as too straightforward, but I think that Hermia being more confident and cocky in this scene will add to the hilarity of it later on.
Kiki and Thomas alternate between looking at me and at Olivia.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So maybe Hermia should be more confident. Make it clear that she thinks that she has her beloved Lysander in the palm of her hand.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And then, when the next day comes and she's confronted with Lysander's change of heart, Hermia loses her composure and goes into a fit of rage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Wouldn't that be funnier and elicit the reaction we want out of the audience?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Lose her composure? So... like our leader here today?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Pfft!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Until now, we've been practicing each scene separately, so this is happening all over.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I think you and I, as troupe leader and playwright, need to discuss more about the characterization and how the performances will reflect it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What do you think?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We're...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...done for today.
Kiki and Thomas' eyes bulge out in sheer surprise.
We go back to the pub, exchanging nary a word on the way.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you okay?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: it's just that, well...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I can't stand it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's like I'm talking to a different person. It's beyond vexing!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Eh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: If you had such good insights, how about coming out with them from the start instead of losing us time, you simpleton?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: O-Oh, sorry?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So, what now?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: How do I direct them?! Tell me already! That's what you've been thinking about, right?!
We talk until it's time for the pub to open, and again when it's time to close.
During those two intervals, I tell her my plan for the play's production.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I see. So this is how you envisioned the story inside your head.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm sorry, there were parts I honestly didn't grasp on my own. But yes, this is a much better way to go about it.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: By simplifying the emotions of each character, the overall feeling of the play will become more intricate as a whole.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Making them laugh in the theater is our first priority. The ironic themes of the story...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: They'll come to them later in the night, when they're gathered at a pub just like this, discussing it over food and ale.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: When you took me to the square to watch the plays of the shopping district...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I realized I should imagine and take into account the kind of life the viewers lead and design a theater-going experience that speaks to them.
Olivia stares at me, disbelief written all over her face, simply nodding in response.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I see...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: At this point, my script only consists of dialogue.
Olivia nods.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Maybe I should start writing stage directions too. It'll make things easier for the actors.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It'll be clearer for everyone if I add instructions about movements and delivery in between the lines.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No, I think it's fine as it is.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: By reading just the line first, I can create an unbiased image of how it should be in my mind.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Then we can amalgamate both our ideas to create something even better.
I nod in response.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That way, even if our scripts happen to be stolen, no one will be able to produce the play quite like we will.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It can be a kind of assurance for us.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Our very own playwright is participating as an actor, so there's no need to bother writing it down.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We can keep the information to ourselves.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's a good idea.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Now that we know about the discrepancies between our own personal visions for the play, from here on out we should make sure to discuss the direction from the very beginning.
I nod again.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But everything I came up with is still just in my head, like you said.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I did? Me? Really?
I nod.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I haven't considered the individuality of each member of the troupe at all.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't know what kind of people they are. That's why I want to leave that judgement to you, leader.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I know them as much as you, which is to say, not much at all.
I blink at her.
She maintains a blank expression.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I don't even know where they live.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Why not?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why would I need to? I don't concern myself with the lives of my slaves. Isn't that natural?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Wait a minute, then why have you wormed your way into my life to the point that you spend almost the entire day with me?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You are irreplaceable. I can hardly keep you out of my sight, can I now?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: All the other members, I could replace anytime.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Err, I'm sure they can tell you feel that way.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Perhaps. I make no effort to hide my disdain.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Do you think that attitude will make them feel motivated to act? I'm asking you as the leader of this whole thing.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I mean, they're slaves. What? Are you gonna complain about that too?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Didn't I already tell you that's the wrong way to deal with them? Have you ever gone for a drink with Kiki or Thomas or any of them?
Her eyes widen in surprise and her expression contorts in indignation.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why would I ever spend time with that rabble?! Of course I've never done such a thing!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Summon them all here tomorrow, and treat them to drinks with your own money.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why would I ever?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Because it'll benefit the troupe. Even if it doesn't, it can't get any worse than it already is.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We have no time, and you need to get to know your whole troupe. At the very least make an effort toward it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Understood?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Lady Olivia?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Damn it all! Fine!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Heheh...
Sitting at his usual corner of the bar, my father simply listens to us with a pleasant smile on his face.
Today, after rehearsal.
Olivia's fidgeting while keeping her distance from Kiki and Thomas.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Phew!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: I'm beat.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Same. Let's go.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: You stopping by the usual place today?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You know it! Can't get by without a drink.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Hahah, same.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Wait.

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Just, wait. Wait, all of you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Wait... Stop right there and don't move.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: We're waiting?
Come on!
You can do it, Olivia Berry!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Y-Yes, I can see that. Y-You're not gonna get anything from me by standing there like a bunch of halfwits!
Olivia, no!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No, that's not what I want to say. Keep it together, Olivia.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Aren't we done here, ma'am?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, the rehearsal is over. But you still can't leave.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Because you're all my bloody slaves!
Noooooooo!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No, that's not it! We're going today. You're coming with me to... drink.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Drink?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Drink what?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ale, what else?!
Almost there!
Olivia turns to me, her eyes blazing.
I look away.
This is her job as a leader.
I pray you can find the strength within you, Olivia!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will's home is a small, dirty pub, you see. Today, you are all coming with me to pay a visit.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Uh, why?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Silence!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No buts!
Kiki and Thomas exchange glances, completely flabbergasted.
The scene makes me titter.
Olivia's head snaps back to me, and she walks up to me with her arm held high.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, you're doing well, Oli—
She slaps me across the face with the force of a thousand suns.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Why?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Because I felt like it! Hurry and guide us there. It's your bloody pub.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: O-Okay.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Well, we have no choice but to go, right?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Certainly looks that way.
With the rest of the troupe in tow, Olivia and I walk to the pub.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Whoa!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: This ain't half bad.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah! This looks cozy! I love it when a place looks like trash but the food is actually good!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't be stupid. It may be good now, but it was barely edible when I set foot in here for the first time.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That hurts.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh? This is Will's home, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, but Olivia's the one who cooks.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: You live here together?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You really think I could live in a rat hole like this? The bed is hard, and the pillows could pass as sandbags.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: So you have stayed the night, then.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Whoa, color me surprised.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Right?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It just happened, okay?! Stop gossiping and come help! Take down the chairs, wipe the tables and the counter! Make it quick!

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: Aye, ma'am.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia, don't make them work. We brought them here to drink.
After a while, my dad comes down the stairs.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Hm? Busy early today, eh?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Someone came down the stairs!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's my dad. He's the owner of this place, kinda.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Will, who are these people?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Troupe friends.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Friends?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: We are?
Kiki and Thomas exchange glances.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: He can't see very well. Don't just stand there, Thomas!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Ah, my bad.
Olivia shouts at Thomas, and he quickly gets out of Dad's usual route to his seat.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kiki, help him walk.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Ah, yes, ma'am.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Oh, sorry to bother you all.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Don't you worry!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: What a lovely lass. Truly, it's a shame my eyes can't see.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I'm a boy, though?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Huh? A boy?! With that voice?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, I have a dingle dangle as well.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Dingle Dangle? What does that mean?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, see?
Kiki puts my father's hand over his crotch.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Hah, I'd say you are simply dangling my chain, lass.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: How rude! Have a touch and see for yourself!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Come on, feel it now?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: For the love of God, Kiki, what are you doing to my father?!
When the pub opens, Olivia's regulars are quick to fill the remaining seats.
The members of the troupe sit at the counter together.
All of them look on in pure disbelief as Olivia serves the customers.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: So kind...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: She's not shouting...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: It looks like she's having fun.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: She looks so friendly too.

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: Like she's a different person...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Shocking, isn't it?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Shocking doesn't do this justice.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I think this may be the first time I've actually seen her smile.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Whoa, we're full up, eh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We kept one spot for you at the bar. That's your seat, right?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Oh, considerate as always, I see!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ale, right?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Aye. Hey, what's with these people?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Will and Olivia's friends, it seems.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Oh? So that means...
Rob stares at Kiki, who's seated next to him.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, I'm a boy. Thank you.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: This adorable lass is a boy?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, I have a dingle dangle.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Dingle dangle? The dangly bits?! You have those?! It can't be!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: She'll let you touch if you ask nicely.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes, feel free to see for yourself. I'm happy to quell your doubts.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Uh, I think I'll take your word for it.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: I am actually, uh, scared of how much I want to take him up on that offer.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: It was a rather cute dingle dangle, I'll have you know.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: You went and touched it, you senile old dog?!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Indeed. It felt like not a dangle at all. Truly a mysterious experience.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: It was a dingle dangle, though?!
The pub stays busy for a while, but as the night rolls on, vacant seats start opening up.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Come join us, Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mm, okay, I'm coming.
Olivia stands beside the counter.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How about we all share a toast together?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, good idea!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: This can be on the house, Will. You all worked hard today, so I'd say you deserve it.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: While I'm grateful for your consideration, I know the pub can't afford to hand out free drinks.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's my troupe, so I'll pay.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Are you the patron of the troupe, Olivia?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, something like that.
I can hardly say that Olivia's a fellow performer.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Right, everyone?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Ah, yes.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Of course. Olivia has no dingle dangle, after all. You took a look between her legs already, didn't you, Will?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: I see, so you're the patron together with Spencer, then. Are you two married, perchance?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We are not married.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Huh. Engaged, then?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Perhaps.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Everyone's good with ale, right?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: No problem here!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How long have you two known each other?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: That's a good question.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Ever since we began burgling together in London, remember? It's been what, fifteen years since then?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Whoa, that's a long time.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Fifteen years?! Wait a moment, how old are you, Kiki?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Tehehee!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Older than me, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Excuse me?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You can't be human...

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: What, you two are thieves?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Ex-thieves, mind you.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: And we made a point to steal only from noblemen.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Along the way, we realized that deceiving nobles was easier than stealing from them.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, so we started selling them shiny baubles and rocks. Fake jewels.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: And they flew out of our hands. Those nobles are a bunch of damn fools!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: But Spencer busted us.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: His aesthetic sense is a level above that of your average aristocrat. If there's one person who can see that everything which glitters is not gold, it's him.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: When he sees something he deems beautiful, he loses sight of everything else. In a sense, he's pretty pure.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But he has no mercy for anything he doesn't deem beautiful. Bringing such crudely fashioned fake jewels before him was the same as asking to have your heads cut off.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Now, that was scary.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: It was more creepy than scary. He didn't make any sense.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, I didn't even know what he was talking about.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So, Olivia paid for you two before he could have your heads cut off?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't most stories have characters like these two? A pair of bumbling fools tripping their way into trouble.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Hahahah, right you are!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: If we got roles like that, we'd hardly need to act!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: We'd fit right in, eh?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Fit right in...
I see, so you can put people in roles that fit them so it's easier for them to adapt.
I fold my arms and think.
Perhaps we're doing something fundamentally wrong in that regard?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Is the play you guys are rehearsing the same one I had Will write the script for?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh? Ah, yes. The same one.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: It's based on that real life rumor I heard on my travels through Italy, is it not?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Rumor?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: This lad here has a downright scary memory.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: More than a good memory, I believe he's incapable of forgetting stuff.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I suppose that's fair to say.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: So, the peddlers who come here aren't only locals from Tenbridge; there are also those who travel around different countries, like me.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: And this lad here remembers every single offhand story they tell.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Some are talkative fellows like Rob who like to gossip over a drink, and others are booksellers.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Books are too expensive for me to buy, but while they're here, I memorize the contents of all the books they bring with them to sell to the nobles.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Now that you're using them as material to write your own plays, it feels kind of suspect, eh?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: That's one heck of a story!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: That's one type of stealing no one will bust you for.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't be foolish. It's not something just anyone could replicate.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Besides, only someone with Will's talent would be able to take all the elements that work from so many sources and put them together to create a wholly new story. He's the only one capable of that.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: If only he had the same competence for running a pub.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It beggars belief, truly.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: So, what kind of story did you end up making from my silly rumor?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Come see it for yourself. The premiere is next week.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Eh? That's so soon!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Theater, eh? I sure wish I could go see Will's play.
I glance at my dad.
Olivia also directs a sympathetic look his way.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Ah, worry not. I don't need anything more from life after touching Kiki's dingle dangle.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes! My dingle dangle is a lot cuter than Will's crossdressing.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Can you stop saying that word? It's gonna give me nightmares.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...You all remember your lines, right?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: S-Somewhat?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Let's recite our lines. It'll be good practice to focus only on the words.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Oh! We get a sneak peek?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Just a little public practice. Don't expect much, though—most of us are ham actors, sadly.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: You hear that, Boss? Looks like we get to hear Will's play!

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: There, gentle Hermia, my love for thee is eternal! May I marry thee?

texts.name: Hermia
texts.text: My good Lysander! I swear to thee, by Cupid's strongest bow. To-morrow truly will I meet with thine, and our eternal will become!

texts.name: Puck
texts.text: Phew, that's one pair down.

texts.name: Helena
texts.text: Ah, Demetrius. Finally, my love for thee has made thee see the light!

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: Good morrow, friends. Saint Valentine is past. Perhaps we were blessed with everlasting love by the summer's court over this midsummer night.

texts.name: Helena
texts.text: Oh, Demetrius. Ne'er leave my side once more!

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: Let us go, Hermia. Before the morrow our vows will be sealed!

texts.name: Hermia
texts.text: Y-Yes, my love!

texts.name: Puck
texts.text: Why, then, finally all are awake! No more yielding but a dream, a gift, they say! Truly, all they did was have a silly midsummer night's dream! Courtesy of yours truly!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Hahah, I see now.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: So that's how the play goes. It's a fun story, yes.
We hold an impromptu recitation of the lines for my blind father.
Olivia decided to fill in the role of one of the actors who couldn't come to the pub.
Or that's the excuse we gave, since she's the main character.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: But Thomas and Kiki, you're definitely not very good at this acting thing, eh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: I've got no talent, that's for sure.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I can't do much else than stand around and look cute.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Hey, Will! You based this Puck fairy on that mischievous kid, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: What did you think, Boss?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Hm? During the whole thing, I was thinking...

texts.name: Father
texts.text: ...that Kiki should be playing Puck.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: I agree.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: B-But, me? A mischievous kid? But I'm so cuuute!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: But he's a bloke, right?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: How about we coin the word femboy? You know, as in a femme-like boy?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Boss, the day a sinful word like that catches on, it'll be the end of the world as we know it.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Heh, indeed.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah... Puck the fairy should have a cuteness that transcends gender.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If Puck becomes the main attraction of the play with Kiki in the role, I'm sure it'll get the audience talking and excited.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But then what do we do about Helena?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Thomas will be Helena.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Huh? I gotta crossdress?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Isn't that going to seem a little forced?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's the same thing we were talking about earlier. If we have Thomas dress up as Helena, her serious scenes won't feel so heavy.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hermia's beloved is stolen from her by Helena, remember? What if Helena looks like Thomas?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It would be the biggest of jokes.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yeah... Wait, isn't that an insult?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Me as Puck? I wonder if it could work...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will, can you write down Puck and Helena's lines?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Sure can.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's okay if you have to read from the script, Thomas, Kiki. Let's give it one more try.

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: There, gentle Hermia, my love for thee is eternal! May I marry thee?

texts.name: Hermia
texts.text: My good Lysander! I swear to thee, by Cupid's strongest bow. To-morrow truly will I meet with thine, and our eternal will become!

texts.name: Puck
texts.text: Phew, that's one pair down.

texts.name: Helena
texts.text: Ah, Demetrius. Finally, my love for thee has made thee see the light!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Pffft!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Ahahahah!

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: Good morrow, friends. Saint Valentine is past. Perhaps we were blessed with everlasting love by the summer's court over this midsummer night.

texts.name: Helena
texts.text: Oh, Demetrius. Ne'er leave my side once more!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Hah, ahahahah! *Cough*!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: This is a bloody riot! Keep it coming! Ahahahah!

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: Let us go, Hermia. Before the morrow our vows will be sealed!

texts.name: Hermia
texts.text: Y-Yes, my love!

texts.name: Puck
texts.text: Why, then, finally all are awake! No more yielding but a dream, a gift, they say! Truly, all they did was have a silly midsummer night's dream! Courtesy of yours truly!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: *Cough* Hah, hahahah! Yes, that's great!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: This is a damn spectacle! Way better than before!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes.
Olivia turns to Kiki and Thomas.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: While I can't in good conscience praise your acting, Thomas...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I can at least tell you for certain that your acting will make the audience feel something.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It wasn't bad. Let's keep this change of roles.
Kiki and Thomas flush in embarrassment.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: We got praised?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Us? By the leader?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Hey, Helena! The blush doesn't suit you!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Ahahahah!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How was it? Did you have fun?
Both of them seem stunned by the sudden words of encouragement.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, it kind of felt like the lines came naturally to me.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Me too!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Damn liar!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm glad. When I wrote the lines, I was imagining the two of you and how you usually are.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You're not playing Puck; Puck was modeled after you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So this Puck can only be played by you. These lines are for your Puck.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: For me, huh?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's the same for Helena, of course.
Thomas' cheeks flush a rosy pink.
Oddly enough, Thomas is a lot more feminine than I thought. I'm honestly surprised.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You can take these new scripts. Have them memorized by tomorrow. You can manage that, right?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: I'll try most valiantly!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Good boys.
Olivia smiles, keeping her eyes fixed on the happy group.
I stare at her profile for a while.
After a moment, she notices my gaze and turns to me with a displeased expression on her face.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What are you staring at?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Nothing.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're getting too big for your boots as of late.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Sorry about that. I am but a lowly slave, Lady Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yeah, you're the image of subservience, all right. There's no need to 'lady' me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You honor me, my lady.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, shut up.
I break into pure laughter.
She pouts, but her lips settle into a sweet smile after a few seconds.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: One more thing.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I finished the first draft.
Her eyes widen upon hearing that.
Then her rose-colored irises light up in expectation.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's called...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Hamlet.
We leave everyone making merry in the pub and head to my room together.
Olivia reads the manuscript in silence.
Her eyes sparkle with interest.
It's enough to tell me that I was able to meet her expectations.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're a bloody genius. I love you.
It makes my heart skip a beat, but there is no feeling behind the words. An aggressive smile spreads from ear to ear on her face, as if something has taken possession of her.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Your dialogues have improved. This is a far cry from the first draft of A Midsummer Night's Dream. Reading this, I can clearly envision how it'll look on stage.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You now have a good grasp of how actors move around the stage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Thanks to you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: However...
Olivia looks at the last page of the manuscript.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The final climax is somewhat weak. Killing everyone with poisoned wine feels like a waste.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kill only one with the poison. It'll have more of an impact that way.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The mother, then.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think that's the best, yes. She could drink from the wine while being aware there's poison in it. Perhaps a shred of maternal instinct drives her to choose suicide.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I see.
In the last scene, Hamlet's uncle tries to take his nephew's life. That is to say, the man who killed his father and married his mother poisons Hamlet's wine.
Upon becoming aware of this, his mother drinks the wine to protect him.
It's a good idea for a proper end to the tragedy.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Because Ophelia loved Hamlet, she's swallowed by his madness and loses her life, right?
I nod.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Then, I think the finale should be a duel between Hamlet and Laertes.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The story can't end until the man who loved Ophelia as a woman and the man who loved her as a sister confront one another.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Right.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I did consider that, but we don't have much time to rehearse. The Admiral's Men are the only troupe who can really pull off sword play scenes, right?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And they're our biggest rivals, remember? Are we supposed to simply cower before them?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But we only have ten days to rehearse this. The sword play would make it flashier, but we can make do with it as it is, no?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We're doing it. Rewrite the scene.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You're gonna be Hamlet, right?
Olivia nods.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You may be able to handle yourself, but you need two for a sword fight. If the other person lacks training, you could get seriously hurt.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: There is no play without pain, Will. Write it in. This scene will go down in history.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I guarantee so.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You would ruin this story over a few flesh wounds for the actors?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I will bear the responsibility as your troupe leader. I've no intention of getting sloppy with the training, so just write it. I want no hesitation on your part.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Understood?
I blow a sigh of resignation.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All right.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Good boy.
I take my quill and sit at the desk.
It's been a week since we adjusted the cast roles.
We've finished rehearsing.
As the quality of rehearsals improved, so too did the quality of the play.
And now, at last, it's premiere day.
A mood of excited tension can be felt in the faces of all the troupe members.
The theater is full.
But there's a certain feeling of unequivocal hostility that makes it hard to believe this is our own theater.
The news of my scuffle with Marlowe spread not only among the theater crowd, but across all of Tenbridge.
A feud between the best of Tenbridge, the Admiral's Men.
And Spencer's troupe, led by Olivia and infamous for their shoddy acting.
The Globe theater is filled with sneers and loud mocking comments.
We all form a small circle behind the stage.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's a full house out there. Feels exhilarating, doesn't it?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Hahah...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Are we gonna be okay?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, are you mayhaps nervous, you two?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Can't deny that.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, and I will tell you why. You cannot wait to overturn this tense atmosphere and make the stage yours.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Acting is no longer simply about killing time for you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You want to show off all the effort you've put into it these past weeks. But you're afraid about whether or not you'll be able to pull it off perfectly, like so many times during rehearsal.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's why you're nervous.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Congratulations, my friends. Today is the day you walk onto that stage as true actors for the first time.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That goes for you as well, Will.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Yeah.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Worry not, I will masterfully cover for all of your mistakes. Thankfully for you, the leader of this troupe was born to stand on the stage.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We can do it, understood?

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: Yes!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Good boys.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Welcome one and all! Today, I, the fairy Puck, have the pleasure of presenting this foolish night of love between two men and women to you!

texts.name: Spectator 1
texts.text: Blimey, how cute!

texts.name: Spectator 2
texts.text: I can barely believe me eyes! Hark at that cutie!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Love... As ephemeral and luscious as a Midsummer Night's Dream.

texts.name: Spectator 1
texts.text: By my fay! This must be folly! How can such cuteness be contained in a body?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: These four love-seeking souls lose themselves in the forest on a May night.

texts.name: Spectator 2
texts.text: But only men can act, right? What is the meaning of this?

texts.name: Spectator 1
texts.text: Huh? You mean to say the lass is a bloke with dangly bits? Thou art cupshot, friend!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: In their hearts, a love for each other burns.
Yesterday, I added some introduction lines for Kiki to recite.
The plan is to hook them in with Kiki and hold their interest by making them look forward to him appearing again.
After the introduction, we can feel the attention of the whole venue converged on us.
The next part seems to be over in the blink of an eye.
I go up on the stage and play the Hermia I based off Olivia's mannerisms. I can immediately tell my performance takes the audience's breath away.
Breath that Thomas, as Helena, proceeds to turn into laughter in mere seconds.
It's a series of up and downs between tension and loud laughter.
Olivia's performance pulls it all together so the interest doesn't fizzle out at any point.
The Midsummer Night's Dream that we created ended up as a play with a wide range of emotional fluctuations.

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: Good morrow, friends. Saint Valentine is past. Perhaps we were blessed with everlasting love by the summer's court over this midsummer night.

texts.name: Helena
texts.text: Oh, Demetrius. Ne'er leave my side once more!

texts.name: Spectator 1
texts.text: Ahahahah! Helena, you look like a dried cow's tongue!

texts.name: Spectator 2
texts.text: Don't wiggle near me!

texts.name: Lysander
texts.text: Let us go, Hermia. Before the morrow our vows will be sealed!

texts.name: Hermia
texts.text: Yes, my love!
Then, Kiki pops up from the wing of the stage.
The audience immediately begins cheering for him.

texts.name: Puck
texts.text: Why, then, finally all are awake! No more yielding but a dream, a gift, they say! Truly, all they did was have a silly midsummer night's dream! Courtesy of yours truly!

texts.name: Spectator 1
texts.text: Puck, me love!

texts.name: Spectator 2
texts.text: Look over here! Let us see that smile!

texts.name: Puck
texts.text: Eheheh!

texts.name: Spectators 1&2
texts.text: Ah, be still me beatin' heart!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Wasn't that incredible?!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: They liked it that much?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Of course they did. We put in the work, didn't we?
Even Olivia looks besides herself with joy.
To be quite honest, I'm relieved.
While we were still rehearsing, I dreamed several times that all our jokes fell flat.
But the audience liked the play more than I ever dared to imagine.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: It's amazing. They're still cheering.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: It just doesn't stop.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: They're waiting for you. Get out there.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, they're not gonna calm down until the bard shows his face!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Looks like you got more work to do, pretty boy.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you sure I should go?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Who else but you? Go now. Make sure this audience won't forget your face for as long as they live.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: This part is yours to play too, William Shakespeare.
As I step onto the stage, the cheers come louder, like a gust lifting me up into the air.
I can't help but smile at them.
Oh, are you watching me from up there, Ed?
It's just as you said.
Our story reached the hearts of so many tonight.
You can see it from where you are, can't you?
I raise my hands to acknowledge their jubilant applause.
Which only makes the cheering grow even more intense.
I regard the audience on the ground floor.
Then I turn to salute the ones in the second and third floors.
Someone calls my name.
My name is now engraved in the memories of all the audience members as the author of this play.
The Globe buzzes with the pure excitement emanating from the crowd.
And here I am, basking in their unbridled adoration.
Olivia was right...
Surely, a man can grow addicted to such a thing.
A pleasure that overshadows even making love to a woman.
...Not that I would know.
I can't tell for certain, sadly.
But...
It certainly is the best moment of my life.
I turn backstage.
Olivia is clapping, a pleased smile gracing her face from ear to ear.
Looking at that smile...
I realize that perhaps it's the reason I have been writing stories up to this day.
When the realization dawns upon me, all the sounds become muted around me.
She's beaming, smiling with her whole face. Her bright rose eyes shimmer like jewels in the shadows behind the stage.
I stare right into her eyes.
She gives me a short nod.
In a daze, I lose myself in her eyes.
Olivia keeps clapping her hands joyfully.
After a while, she explodes in laughter.
With an amused smile on her face, she points me to the audience with her chin.
But looking at anything but her smile would be the gravest of sins for me.
I want to stay in this mute world, watching her smile for all eternity.
There is no wish more fervent in my heart.
Alas, the roaring cheer pulls me back to reality.
I turn back to the audience.
And I raise my arms towards them again.
They keep calling my name in standing ovation.
I'm glad to be able to write.
I'm happy I joined this troupe.
I'm infinitely thankful to Olivia for showing me the world beyond my narrow counter.
I'm glad we met that night. Of that, I am certain.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And that's what happened.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Our premiere was a smashing success!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Ooh!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And it's time to celebrate, of course.
...But I don't see Olivia anywhere.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Where's the leader? Oh, I don't see Thomas around either.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Thomas sure takes a long time to take off the make up. He's not used to dealing with dresses yet either.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Ahahaha! He could give a show to our customers here!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Hah, it really went that well tonight?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: It was the best night ever! There were even some members of the audience looking for me after it was all said and done! They wanted to drown me with praise personally!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Ahahaha! And you're happy about that?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's fine. I'm sure the audience will talk Kiki up all around town.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And the ones who get attached to him will keep coming back for more.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: But won't people get bored of seeing the same play all the time?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: In the meantime, we'll rehearse for a tragedy to change up the mood from today's comedy.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That'll shake up the audience and get the whole city talking about us.

texts.name: Will
