texts.text: It seems that the Queen decides which troupe will perform for the court next based on what plays people in town are talking about, so we're trying to get our name out there.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We don't have a huge repertoire of plays to draw from like the Admiral's Men just yet, so that's our best shot.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: If you used a tenth of that sagacity to run this pub, I bet we'd have a branch in the middle of the fountain square by now.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm not made for this kind of work, and you know that.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Better than anyone.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Can't deny it.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Do you know what this tragedy will be about already?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, I finished writing it. Actually, I wanted to talk about it tonight.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But they're taking so long. Should we begin without them?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: It'd feel wrong to begin without our leader here.
Kiki says, his shoulders drooping a little.
Seeing his disappointment brings a smile to my face. We're a real team now, I feel.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll go fetch them. They must still be at the theater. Let's see if she doesn't bite my head off for trying to give her orders.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: See you in the other life, just in case!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: No more deer stealing attempts, you hear me?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I won't, thanks for the concern. You can wait here for us. Drink all you want, just don't get drunk.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Nah, I think I'll wait.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Hah...
At last.
Finally, I made it.
The ear splitting cheers.
The satisfaction painted on the faces of the audience.
As soon as I close my eyes, they come back to me as clear as the light of day.
The stars look so near, as if I could reach out and touch them.
Will kept his promise.
I wanted him to do whatever it took to move me to tears.
That's what I ordered him to do when we met.
And he kept his promise, and did so much more.
On the day of our first performance.
He's a great man.
No, he became a great man.
He overcame all the challenges I had him face these last few days.
I remember the day he tried to steal the deer.
The way his eyes resembled those of a lost child brings a smile to my face.
That sheen of anxiety is gone from them now.
Today, he stood on the stage as a man, imposing and respectable.
I need to be careful around him from now on, or he might very well end up stealing my breath away.
His Hermia was beautiful beyond words.
I wipe away the tears pooling at the corners of my eyes.
I can't be seen by the other troupe members being this sentimental.
We merely took our first step.
With them by my side, I am sure we can aim for the moon.
Leader.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ah!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, Thomas. Don't sneak up on me like that. What is it?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: It takes me so long to take off the make up. It just won't come off!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Get used to it. You'd just sweat it away if we didn't cake it on like that.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yes, ma'am. We're going to Will's pub now, right?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ah, yes, yes. I need to change first. You go on ahead.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yes, ma'am.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't you go starting the party without me.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Understood, ma'am.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mm...
I watch the lanky man scratching his face as he walks away.
I still find it hard to believe that he can perform a comical role so well.
We could add a jester like him to any play we make.
Even in a tragedy, you need to a character to add some levity to the proceedings.
I never imagined the day would come when he would become an invaluable asset to our troupe.
When Thomas is gone, I turn to the wings of the stage.
Olive.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: *Sigh* What now?!
When I turn around...
I find myself staring at the person who I want to see the least in the world.
Why? Why now?
I bite my lip and repress the shudders threatening to rack my body.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Lord Spencer.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I saw it all, Olive. It was a most curiously exciting display.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I suppose...

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: That deer loving chico is the one who wrote that? What was his name? Ah, yes, Shakespeare.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You were absolutely right. He certainly was able to show something more hermoso than his head on a pike.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Your words honor me.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: And that girl was quite nice as well. Puck the fairy, was it? They were extremely linda.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Is she like you? A chica pretending to have a cute little amigo down there?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No, he's a man, Lord Spencer.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Hoo! Bellisimo! So that means that the chico has an amigo dangling between his legs?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Pecking at it like a lindo pajaro would be most exciting, wouldn't you say?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Do bring him along so he can entertain me one of these days.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes... If circumstances allow...

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: But, I do believe the one that brillo the brightest...

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: ...was you, Olive.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Again, your words honor me.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Watching you dress as a chico was most thrilling... Ah, I want to hold you in my arms. Defile that otherworldly beauty that is neither man nor woman.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Ahora mismo, right now.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Please, Lord Spencer, not here...

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Que? What did you say, Olive?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I am quite fatigued from the intensive rehearsals, and the troupe members are always coming and going—

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Para, stop. Olive, who am I?
I can feel a building ire behind his words.
Even now...
Hearing that tone makes my body tense reflexively.
I'm so pathetic.
I hate that I yield to this man out of fear. Hate it with every fiber of my being.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Quien soy yo? Who am I?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Lord Harold Spencer.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Si, and you are Olivia Berry. You are my...?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Answer, Olive. I want to hear it from your labios.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Your slave.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: That's what I thought. Don't you ever forget our reglas, our rules. This theater also belongs to me.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: What happens to MY esclava inside of MY theater is for ME to decide.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: ME, ME, ME, y nadie mas que ME!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I beg you. Please spare me, just for today.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: My troupe members are waiting for me. I beg for lenience, my Lord.
I lower my head to him.
I don't want this.
Not today.
Just this one day.
I want to enjoy this happiness Will gave me.
I don't want it to be crumpled and broken like this.
Not like this...
I don't want my memories of this day to be marred by this man. I don't want to remember this day as yet another one where I was violated.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Please, I beg you...

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Let's go inside, Olive.
Spencer yanks my arm and drags me backstage.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ah!

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Didn't I tell you that there would be no mercy next time?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Go inside and take off your trousers. Keep the top on. I feel like doing it with a chico today.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: That's an order.
His whisper freezes me to the core.
This man's voice is a curse.
A curse that robs my body of its freedom.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Yes.
Doing as he says, I turn on my heels and walk to the antechamber.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hah... Hah...
I run back to the theater.
By all accounts, I should be tired, but I feel strangely light on my feet.
Even my labored breaths feel wonderful in my chest.
I notice another figure running down the street, heading in my direction.
I can't help but smile.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Oh, is that you, Will?
The familiar lanky man swaggers his way down the street.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Where's the leader?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Still at the theater. She was spacing out back there.
My smile turns a little bitter.
Is she still basking in today's success?
That's the Olivia I know.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Where's everyone else?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Waiting at the pub. You go on ahead, I'll bring her over.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Got that, my good man. See you there.
The theater comes into view.
It's hard to believe that this quiet place was full of cheer and joy until not so long ago.
I hurry through the gates, impatient to see her.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?
But she's nowhere to be seen.
It's a little late to be changing clothes.
I know for a fact that she more than any of us wanted today's play to be a success.
I was certain she'd be standing by herself on the stage getting sentimental.
I'm sure she doesn't want the others to see her like that.
That's why I thought to come alone.
I look over the stage.
The time I spent on it was the best of my life.
All eyes were on us.
The audience laughed at our jokes and applauded until their hands were sore.
That moment was so special that I forgot all about my contest with Marlowe.
The first day she brought me here...
Olivia must have been looking at the stage with the same feeling I have now.
When I remember that night, a smile comes to my lips.
Step by step, I approach the stage.
I stand where Olivia stood during rehearsals.
A position from which you can overlook one end of the stage to the other.
And then...
From backstage, I hear the thud of something falling.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia? Are you there?
The backstage area is separated by a thick curtain.
I reach for the cloth and...

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Oh?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You...

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You are... Shakespeare!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Spencer.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Mm? What is it?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Uh, nothing.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I saw your hermosa performance today.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: It was truly magnifico. Are you going to keep writing and exercise that creativo brain of yours? I mean, it would be a waste not to.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will. I was planning to from the beginning.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Oh, and your dress, it was simply sublime. If you ever grow weary of being Olivia's esclavo, come to me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, uh, thanks...

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Though you're still not as hermoso as Olivia. That said, you are quite precioso indeed.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: A precioso, shining chico. I do believe you have room to grow and spread your wings.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Okay?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Bien, muy bien.
What's bien?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I shall come to watch you act again, buenas noches.
Spencer walks past me and leaves the theater swiftly.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What was he doing here?
After watching him leave, I go backstage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia?
When I call out to her, Olivia's shoulders twitch in the dark.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will?
She's changed into her usual dress.
But her clothes look a bit disheveled.
Maybe she was in the middle of changing.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ah, sorry. I wasn't peeping on you or anything.
Her eyes are swimming about.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's late, so I was wondering where you were.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Everyone's waiting for you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Right...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We can't celebrate without our leader, can we?
She doesn't respond.
Something's off.
I stare at her for a moment.
She turns away from me and speaks with her back to me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Did you see that?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: See what?
Her gaze still wanders.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I didn't see you changing clothes.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Right.
Then, I notice her costume scattered on the floor.
She follows my gaze and goes to pick it up in a hurry.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What's wrong? You're acting strange.
Olivia keeps her head down, refusing to look at me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Did something happen with Spencer? Did he do something to you?
Her head snaps back to me, and I see fear in her eyes.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh? We just passed each other on the stage.
Silence falls.
An awkward, pregnant silence.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What's wrong? Did something happen?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia? What happened?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Nothing at all.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Don't lie to me. I can't do anything if you don't talk to me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You want to know? You're gonna make me say it?
Olivia sniggers.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Right, you won't understand unless I spell it out, will you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What?
Olivia turns to me, clearly at her wit's end.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I was just sharing an intimate moment with my fiance backstage. You have a problem with that?
I look at the bundle of clothes she's holding.
It's the Lysander costume she wore on stage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Here? Just now?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, that's what I said.
Olivia answers my question without blinking.
Like she's just swatting down a fly.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What, you have something to say?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No...
Olivia glares at me, still holding the costume in her arms.
At a loss, I hang my head and look down at the floor.
For a moment I picture them doing that here, but I quickly push the thought from my mind.
It has nothing to do with me. It's between the two of them.
I don't have the right to say anything.
The silence extends.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I do it for my own benefit. No one has the right to belittle me over it.
She murmurs slowly, each word more marked than the last.
I raise my face and look at her.
Her eyes seem out of focus.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I couldn't keep on living otherwise. I couldn't own the stage I saw for myself.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You've no reason to find fault with my actions. I have no regrets.
Olivia says, staring into my eyes.
Silent tears trail down her face.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...are no good at acting this role.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm not going to find fault or belittle you. If this is what you want to do, that's all there is to it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's just as you say. If you have no regrets and are satisfied with this, I won't say a word.
She bites down on her lower lip.
The tears keep on rolling with no sign of stopping.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It doesn't seem like that's the case.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: How would you even know such a thing?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Then let me ask you this.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Why are you crying?
It seems like she's about to say something, but she chokes on the words.
Instead, she just bites her lip and says nothing.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If you truly have no regrets...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Why do you look so terribly miserable?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Silence!
Olivia throws her costume at me and storms out onto the stage.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: *Sob*
The tears won't stop.
I ran away from him in the heat of the moment.
His steady gaze, his words of concern.
I simply can't bear it.
I can still feel Spencer in me.
It's revolting. I detest it with every fiber of my being.
I want to scratch at my body until my skin tears and I can scrub out the lingering feeling from within.
But I can't rid myself of the sensation.
I don't want to face Will like this, dirtied and sullied.
The tears keep falling down my face.
They create streaks down my cheeks and run down my neck.
Normally, I could stop at the drop of a hat.
I could conjure up a bold smile to hide behind.
But this time, I can't.
Even though I know I can't afford even one second of not being an actress in front of others.
I know this, and yet...
I can't force my face muscles to make any expression.
I can't do anything but cry like a little girl.
All the faces I practiced just aren't coming to me.
I'm supposed to be a bloody actress.
I hear Will's footsteps from behind.
They grow closer, then stop.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Go away. I don't want to see you right now.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I... I'm dirty now...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I don't want you to see me like this.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Dirty how?
Will's tone is calm, gentle.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: All of me, everything. My body. My heart.
I say, closing my eyes.
I manage hold back the overwhelming sob threatening to force its way out of my throat.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I was the one who decided that I was okay with this.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I would do anything I needed to be an actress, to stand on the stage!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Sleep with my patron, and make the whole troupe my slaves.
My voice comes out like a shivering whimper.
That's what I hear as it reaches my ears.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I have no other means, no way other than that.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Even so...
I look down at my feet.
Tears patter onto the dry wood below.
One after the other.
The tears fall like rain on the ground.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're the only one I didn't want to know.
I can hear Will's steady breathing from behind me.
What kind of expression is on his face as he watches me?
I am deathly afraid to look.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I didn't want you to know. You're the last person I wanted to see me like this.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I don't know!
If we met under different circumstances...
If I were from a different background...
If I were born to a family of nobles from the beginning...
Perhaps I could have honestly told him that I wanted him to hold me, to love me.
I would have been able to express my feelings, tell him about this love for him that burns more intensely inside my chest with every passing day.
But it's too late now.
I am too late.
It's been too late since the moment I was born.
Will takes another step closer.
I can feel his faint warmth on my back.
And then...
He gently wraps his arms around me.
I can feel his cheek brushing against my hair.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What are you doing?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't know either.
I hear his voice near to my ear.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Stop. Let go of me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You never think about the consequences of your actions.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You haven't learned a thing since the day we met.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I like to think I wear my heart on my sleeve.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But I still won't let you go.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Because the woman I love is crying in front of me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Are you stupid? Did you lose your mind?
I muster the courage to snap back at him.
But I can't summon the will to move away from him.
His warm, gentle embrace...
I can't bring myself to leave it.
He's holding me tenderly, lovingly.
I can feel his resolve, his force, his scent, the beat of his heart against my back.
His everything is trying to heal me.
Now that I know how this feels, there is no way back.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What do you mean to accomplish by doing this?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I won't let you go to that man anymore.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Impossible.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Don't go.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I can't.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will save you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You don't have that power, sadly.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, I do. In fact, I am the only one who can do it.
Will holds me a little closer to himself.
He envelops me with more force.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The only person who can make you shine on the stage...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...is me. No one else in the world.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And for that we only need you and me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We don't need this big theater.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Even if we don't have a stage...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll make you the actress of my stories.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will be the only man in the world to do it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll make you an actress.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So, please...
I continue crying as I listen to his speech.
Each of his words seem to permeate my body like a sweet perfume.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Don't go to that man anymore.
I shake my head limply.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The actors of a troupe without a patron are the same as vagrants.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's what the whole troupe will become, and so will you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We were all tramps from the beginning. All of us but you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Heh, I'd like to know what Kiki and the others think about that.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Don't go back to that manor again. Stay with me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will, I can't just...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I won't let you go until you promise.
He's holding me tightly.
When did I become this indulgent?
Since when have I been this weak a person?
Reality always disappoints.
I know that better than anyone, and yet...
Instead of shaking my head, I sigh.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Perhaps fools attract one another.
I mutter with a self-deprecating chuckle.
Will doesn't laugh.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia.
...nod weakly.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: All right. I promise.
I place my hand over his.
His hands are bigger and stronger than I realized.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Good girl.
Our steps are the only sound in the quiet city street.
I walk in front, holding Olivia's hand tight.
She stays silent, clasping my hand in return.
A stream of thoughts flow through my mind one after another.
But there is something I notice in me. A feeling I've never had before.
Back then, I couldn't protect Ed.
This time, I will protect the people I love.
I grip Olivia's hand with even more force.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No need to crush my hand, I'm not going anywhere.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ah, sorry.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Nervous just from holding hands? You can be quite adorable sometimes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Says the woman who was crying just now.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mention that in front of anyone and I'll kill you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: As if I would.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I had to make sure, since you have as much tact as a cow.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That goes for you too.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Hah, indeed.
Olivia bashes me verbally but doesn't let go of my hand.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Maybe we should tell everyone.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That we're going to lose Spencer's support.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I may not be able to pay for the living expenses I was giving them.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The Globe belongs to him as well.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's decide what to do tomorrow, when we're all together.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Today, everyone's waiting to enjoy a good time with you and make merry.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll have to tell my father what's happening.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: For now, you can live with us.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, I'd like that.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Do you have any belongings to bring with you?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I have few things. Most of what I need, I keep at the theater.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I only went to the manor to play the role of a decoration for him.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We'll manage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Our pub isn't going out of business any time soon. The troupe will be fine.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, right.
I can feel her tightening her hand around mine.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you nervous?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Do you have a death wish? How dare you imply that. Don't lump me in with nervous wrecks like you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's the spirit.
I smile at her sullen face.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Thank you for accepting me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It means a lot.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Okay, who are you, and what did you do with Olivia?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, will you shut up!
I squeeze her hand again.
She returns it with a squeeze of her own.
Slowly, we walk side by side through the night.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Whoa, took you long enough!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Do you enjoy making us wait?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Sorry, all! We thought it'd be good to prepare for tomorrow while we were at the theater.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I hope no one started drinking without us.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Look at this lass! Who does she think we've been waiting for?!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: We didn't have a single drop. No one's brave enough to cross our leader.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ahahah, good boys. Well done.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Okay, let me get us all some drinks.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'll help.
I pour ale into the cups, and Olivia gets the cups into people's hands.
Eventually everyone has a cup of ale, except for my father.
He's looks miffed, sitting in his corner holding a cup of water.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Everyone, you did most magnificently today. Good work. I think it was a very good performance, but there's always room for improvement.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We will rehearse before raising the curtains tomorrow, so don't drink too much.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Eep!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kiki, you became the troupe's main draw today. Hold your head high.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Me? The main draw?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You were very popular too, Thomas. Brace yourself, the public still has a lot more of you to see.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yes, ma'am!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We have many challenges ahead of us, but...
Olivia trails off and looks at me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We'll be chosen for the court performance no matter what. Isn't that right, Will?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Naturally. My scripts are the best in the world.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Well said, William Shakespeare.
A satisfied smile touches her lips as she turns back to the others.
Looking at her profile, I see the usual Olivia.
She's a great actress.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: To this fleeting moment that will stay with us forever, like a midsummer night's dream...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Cheers, my friends.

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: Cheers!

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Heheh. Boss, let's do a little toast of our own.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Toasting with water would be the saddest thing.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Who cares? Will's talent is finally blossoming. No happier occasion than this.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Yes, you are right indeed.
Rob raises his cup.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: To the ones we lost. To Ed.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: To friendship everlasting.
Dad and Rob clink their cups together.
Olivia's eyes meet with mine.
She raises her cup as well.
I follow her lead and lift mine.
We share a personal toast from behind the bar.
We eat, drink, and make merry with the rest of the troupe members as the night rolls on.
When it's time to go, we see everyone off until it's just me, Olivia, Rob, and Dad left in the pub.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Well then, it's about time for this old dog to hit the hay.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: You're not going home yet, Rob?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: I'll be on my way after I finish this drink.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: All right. See you all on the morrow, then.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Dad.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: How may I help you, Lord Playwright?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I need to tell you something.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Huh? What is it?
Dad looks up in my direction.
I let my gaze linger over the counter for a moment.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Huh? Family matter? Want me to leave so you can talk?
I exchange glances with Olivia.
She shakes her head firmly.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're a peddler who visits the manor frequently enough. I'm sure you'd come to know sooner or later, so it may as well be now.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All right.
I step out from behind the counter and face both Rob and my dad.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'd like Olivia to live here from now on.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Err, why, you ask?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: I mean, aren't you Spencer's fiancee?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Don't you have to go back to him?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: There is no engagement between us.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: External pressures and expectations made everyone assume so, and it's true that's what he wants from me, but there is nothing set in stone.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Wait, what? What do you mean?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Olivia, are you truly turning down a rich man to settle down for this lousy cook?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Hahahah, you're gonna regret it later!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's not what this is about, Dad.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I will never regret it. That, I can assure you.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Oh...
I stare at Olivia's profile in disbelief.
She gives me a small smile then turns back to my dad and Rob.
The two of them look from one to the other of us.
Olivia blows out a small sigh, and speaks.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I was bought too.
The two of them look at her.
I also turn to her.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Bought? What do you mean?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I wasn't born in this country.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: So you're from the island out west, eh?
Olivia nods.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I was brought here, and my siblings were taken to the New World to work as slaves. I was auctioned off on account of my looks.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: A story as old as time, is it not?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...were a slave too?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes.
Rob and Dad simply look up at her in silence.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Because of where I was born, that's all.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What other reason do "civilized" people need to make slaves out of others?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ah, perhaps trying to steal a deer would have been a better reason?
Olivia says, quirking up a smile.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's an exception.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, that's right. I'll have you know that I wouldn't have failed; I never did. Failing was the difference between life and death.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Just as people are born into noble houses on no merit of their own, people are also born as slaves through no fault of their own.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I did what I needed to stay alive. Whatever job, no matter what it was.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And when I had no job, I simply stole from others.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: For better of worse, I never had to kill a person, but I believe I would have done so should the situation have called for it.
I am speechless after hearing about Olivia's life.
But at the same time, a lot of things make sense now.
Why her manner of speech is different from all the other nobles.
Why a noble like her would know how to cook and clean.
Ed and Rob picked up on all that as soon as she started helping in the pub.
Olivia was always different from the image I had of the aristocracy.
I feel like all those incongruities are coming together now.
So she wasn't born a noble.
No, even now she doesn't truly have the freedom of the ruling classes.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: When I was ripped away from my family and auctioned off, Spencer was the one who bid on me.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Auctioned off? Then where does all this fiancee talk come from?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: He said he wanted to marry me. Even though I'm his slave? That man is strange, not normal at all.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Yeah, I can see that.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Is that Spencer man such a strange noble?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: He's a deviant. I can never see any rhyme or reason to what he says or does.
Olivia nods in agreement, and so does Rob as he downs his cup of ale.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Because of where I come from...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: My situation resembles yours, in a sense.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Yes, that island...
I hear that Catholics account for more than eighty percent of the population.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: During the Ulster rebellion 16 years ago, my siblings and I were imprisoned and sent to this country.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Back when we were still in our own country, almost starving to death, a kind man in scarlet robes took notice and fed us from his bread.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Scarlet robes?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: A cardinal of the church, you mean?
A meaningful smiles crosses her face.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We thought so at the time. We were overjoyed, thinking that believers truly extended a helping hand to others.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But we realized as soon as we came closer—the man's mantle stank.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It was dyed red with blood. By the time we realized he was a slave dealer, it was already too late.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: My sister and I were sold off to different houses. They would use me as they saw fit, and I would escape, only to repeat that cycle until I got to Tenbridge.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The day I was bought by Spencer and told I was going to be his slave, I didn't have the energy to resist my rotten fortune anymore.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Until I was taken to a court performance by Spencer and saw the resplendent beauty of theater with my own two eyes. Until then, my world was gray, quite literally.
No one dares say a word.
Olivia continues talking.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So, to clarify. I am not his fiancee.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But it is true that I used that as bait to get him to become the patron of my acting troupe.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I did that to keep this troupe doing.
She falls silent, having finished her tale.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Can I ask a question? Why are you going so far for this? You're the owner of the troupe, right?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: But it almost sounds as if you...
We've finally come to the heart of the matter.
Until now, we've kept the fact that she acts on stage hidden.
The idea of a woman dressing as a man is looked down upon and decried even among Catholics.
I would have liked to sidestep this topic if at all possible.
But...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...stand on the stage, as a man.
Olivia tells them the truth, resolute and decisive.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think it's wrong that a woman can't act on stage. That's why my goal is to be chosen for a court performance.
Rob squints at her.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: What do you mean?
I haven't heard about this from her either.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: If we are selected and our abilities are recognized, we can become the Lord Chamberlain's Men.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The troupe closest to the Queen's ear.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And being near the only person with the power to change the law means we can—

texts.name: Father
texts.text: You are aiming to endear yourself to the theater loving Queen, then.
Olivia nods.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: That is one tough battle you're fighting, lass.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But that's what gives my life meaning.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's an injustice that a woman can't stand on the stage that bestows dreams and hopes onto people's lives. Why do we decide who can act or not based on something as arbitrary as gender?
Rob and dad simply stare at her in silence.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The dazzling world of theater gave my drab life color.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I can't even remember what the play that inspired me was about anymore. I just cried at the end, not even knowing why.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: From that moment on, I wanted to stand on the stage too. I had no choice but to take back my own life.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's why I desperately searched for a way to do so, and brought this troupe together.
Now she turns to me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And finally, I obtained the talent I needed from Will's hand.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: For me, acting in this troupe is what gives my life hope.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: I see now.
Silence fills the room.
A long, heavy silence.
I imagine a young Olivia in my mind.
Hearing her talk, I understood immediately that she has many more bitter memories locked away inside of her.
Compared to her, I certainly am a pampered, blessed boy.
I pitied myself and thought of myself as the center of the world. It was all about me and not getting what I perceived as my right.
But...
That was before I met her.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Now...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This troupe isn't just yours. Kiki, Thomas, and everyone else are desperate to improve.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I want to do everything I can for this troupe as well.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Now that I know about all the sacrifices you had to make.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I need to do something about it.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: So you want to rescue her from her predicament and let her live with us?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: But didn't you just finish your first performance today?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: What happens now?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Well...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I figured I'd cross those bridges as I come to them.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Hah! You're going off the cuff, eh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The Globe is Spencer's property, but even if we're kicked out tomorrow, I don't think he would find a new tenant anytime soon.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Thankfully, our premiere was well received, and I think we'll have full seats going forward.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Spencer may be a noble, but his rank is only that of a landed gentry. And he needs funds to prepare for his move to the New World.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: If we use the admission fees to pay him rent, I think he'll let us rent the place like a business.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: When it comes to money, that's the only matter where he actually makes sensible decisions.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: He has a rather gaudy life to be part of the gentry.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Perhaps he has both an eye for aesthetics and another one for business.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You can take what comes out of his mouth at face value. He is no schemer, at the very least.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: I see. So as someone who sells to him, that must make me a purveyor of the finest goods, yes?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I don't know about that.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: So, Will, what is it that you wanted to ask me about?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh? I wanted your permission to let Olivia live here with us for now.
My dad looks up at me while I trip over my words.
Even if there's no light in his eyes, I still feel like he can see right through me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I wanted to know if you're okay with it.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: So what if I were to say no? You'd give up?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: After listening to her story, I don't think Olivia's a woman who you can approach without having a made up mind and an iron will.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Isn't that right, Rob?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Well, she is a tough woman, that's for sure.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: This is not about my personality, is it?
Olivia interjects, but my dad keeps his eyes on me.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Son, you won't take Olivia from that noble by fretting over every single thing.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: This isn't like stealing a deer.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Heheh. You may be right, good sir.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All right.
Dad's absolutely right.
I take a deep breath.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia will be living in our house from now on. I'm sorry if that's a bother for you, but I hope you'll be understanding.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Heard you loud a clear.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Ah, to be young.
I turn to Olivia.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You can sleep in my room today. I'll sleep on the floor.
Olivia nods in response.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will go and negotiate with Spencer, so...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Tell me the costs we'll incur to keep the troupe going and our projected income.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If we need new works to keep afloat, I'll write as much as we need.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But I should be the one to talk to him.
I hold up my hand in front of her.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This is my job. You don't need to see that man ever again.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Boss, our little lad's done some growing up, eh?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Shall we toast to that?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: With water once more, I suppose.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Who cares about what's in the cup? Come on now.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Yeah, you're right.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We have some space on the first floor, don't you think? We could pack more people in there if we get more seats.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We sold out of meals today, so let's prepare more for tomorrow. If we make as much as we can, we could earn about thirty percent more, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Is that all of the proceeds?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How about the expenses?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I give the troupe members a weekly salary. This is the minimum we need.
Olivia writes down the amount she's giving each person.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hey, why didn't I ever get money like this?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I pay you in kind, don't I? How much do you think I contribute to this pub's sales? You bold-faced, greedy fox.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I know, I'm just kidding.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How much should we estimate for the Globe's rent?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mm, for a theater that size...
Olivia writes down the amount.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you serious?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The place can hold two hundred times the capacity of this pub. It's just how it is.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And...
Olivia writes another amount of money below that.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Payment to get out of bondage. Slaves have to pay their owners for their freedom.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Owner...
Her mouth becomes a hard line, and she hangs her head.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Okay, I'll pay. I'll negotiate it so we can pay in installments.
We finish calculating all the expenses.
And considering our current admission fees...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We need a full house every day, huh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, we do.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No holidays for us, it seems.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That was the plan from the start, but what I'm worried about is audience fatigue setting in.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We may have the play down, but it's still only one play.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It may be difficult to keep pulling in an audience every day for a whole month with just the one.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's begin rehearsing the tragedy's first draft as as soon as we can. How much time do you want to spend rehearsing Midsummer Night's Dream before the performance tomorrow?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Hmm. I'd like to take about an hour for it, but I don't think we'll need as much time after that.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Rather than keep tweaking a work to perfection, I want to get the audience excited and give them something new.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But I really want at least an hour for it tomorrow. We can rehearse the new play as much as you want after that.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How much time do you think it'll take to have Hamlet in a good place? All five acts, I mean.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: To be honest, it should take about a month. But we obviously don't have that much time.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Two weeks. No, one.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ten days. Let's spend the first five days on each act, and the other five running through the whole thing each day.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We'll be rushing, but we hardly have a choice.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But we could maybe announce we're presenting a new play on the seventh day, and premiere it on the eighth if we feel the troupe is ready for it.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That is, if we strike upon a miracle every single day and everything goes well. We shouldn't try to push it any sooner than ten days.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Remember, we're gonna be practicing while also performing every single day.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Right.
Ten days from now, we'll add Hamlet to our repertoire.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Even if we have two plays to perform, we can't have two showings every day, can we?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Not likely. It would be night by the time we started the second showing.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How about we start at noon?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Then we'll be unable to practice new plays.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mmh...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And if we have to perform five acts every single day, it'll wear out the actors' focus.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You realized that today too, didn't you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So, for the next ten days, we'll continue with A Midsummer Night's Dream.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And then we premiere Hamlet. Do we want to add another one before the court selection?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We'll need a new play by then.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So after than tenth day, we need to start rehearsing a new play in the mornings while performing Hamlet in the evenings.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Once we have Hamlet in our repertoire, we could alternate between it and Midsummer Night's Dream.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: If we can get a new play out every ten days, we'll definitely get the audience to come back to the theater every ten days too, at the very least.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I see. In that case...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We'll be able to pay.
A smile touches her lips.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Can you write a new play after this?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will. I must.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes.
Silence falls over the room.
Olivia's looking out at the moon outside the window.
The shine of the moonlight makes her porcelain skin glow with an almost magical sheen.
I feel something inside my chest swell as I watch her.
Staying here alone with her isn't good for my sanity.
I feel like some kind of beast inside me is struggling to break loose.
I get up and shake my head.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What's wrong?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll go talk to Spencer.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Right now?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Today is the last day this troupe has a patron.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If we don't do things properly, nothing will change.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll be back.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're going alone?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Spencer and I have to reach a settlement regarding your situation.
Her expression darkens.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Okay.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It'll be fine.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'll wait up for you.
I nod, take one last look at the balance figures, and leave the room.
The huge manor looms over me as I stand in the vast patch of land that belongs to the estate.
I take a deep breath as I look over its gigantic, opulent presence.
I need to face Spencer.
I look back on our two previous encounters.
Has he ever really listened to anything I said? It always feels like he's talking at me, instead of to me.
Somehow, it doesn't even feel like we're speaking the same language.
But I must do this.
For Olivia.
After bracing myself and taking a deep breath, I knock on the door.
An elderly butler opens the door, and I inform him that I've come to speak to Spencer about Olivia.
After giving me a glance over, he ushers me inside.
This is the hall I was brought to when I tried to steal the deer.
The butler seems to remember me.
Which means he remembers that day when I became Olivia's slave.
The butler goes up a big flight of stairs and knocks on one of the many doors.
He says something to the person behind the door, then comes down the stairs again.
He informs me that Spencer will be with me shortly, then wanders off somewhere.
My palms are sweaty.
After a while, the door the butler knocked on opens, and Spencer comes out of the room.
He comes down the stairs with relaxed, light steps.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Hi, chico.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Good evening.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I am told you wish to talk about my little Olive? What is it? Did you get fed up of being her esclavo?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: From today, Olivia is no longer your slave.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Hmm?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If you want money to settle this, I'll pay it. I also want to rent the Globe theater.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Since Olivia won't be your slave anymore, it wouldn't make sense for you to patron the troupe. That's why I've come to rent it.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You mean to pay for her, you mean? You are Olivia's esclavo, are you not?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: What is the meaning of this? Are you making an esclava out of her now?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia will be a free woman from now on. She won't be anyone's property anymore.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Hmm, so you will foot the costo for that?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: There is no chica as beautiful as Olive. She's quite expensive.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: State your price.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Hm...
The price Spencer tells me is the exact amount Olivia wrote down.
Spencer's eyes widen in surprise as I nod and accept the offer.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll pay. I just need to pay in instalments.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Instalments?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll pay for it together with the Globe's monthly rent. You can attach an interest rate to the payments if you want.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You can't really rent that big theater to anyone but people making plays, can you?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You are correcto. Yes, I would not mind renting it to you, Shakespeare.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: But can you pay? You're not coming to me without a plan, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The premiere of the play I wrote for the troupe was today. We filled the whole theater and the sales were good.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Felicitaciones. Good for you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will write two more plays this month. If we keep the seats full and attract the audience back every ten days, we'll be able to pay you.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: And after that?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Our troupe...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...will be selected for the court performance. After that we'll have a new patron and pay off the remainder of our debts.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I see. You aim for the Lord Chamberlain to shoulder the cost.
Spencer nods to himself.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Good, chicos must be ambitious. I don't dislike your enthusiasm.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I find such lofty aspirations very calientes indeed in people with the capacity. As for you...
Spencer looks me up and down slowly, sizing me up.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Yes, you are a chico with the talent to meet your goals. I think you will achieve it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Thanks.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Okay, we have a trato. Do with Olive as you please. She is tuya now.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Huh? Isn't that what you came here for?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, but...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I heard that you asked Olivia to marry you, so...
Spencer looks genuinely curious about my confusion.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You would let go of her that easily?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: No problema. There's no problem at all. Tell Olive she is free to come back to me if she ever needs help.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: She can become my esclava once again whenever she likes. I look after my esclavos, that's my personal policy.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: She's not a slave.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Olive became my esclava out of her own volition. It is her choice, not to be made by you.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: But I do not dislike change. Me gusta, to be honest.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Well, do try your best, playwright. Let us hope it goes well for you.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: And one more thing. I will need a guarantee in the case your plan doesn't go, well, as planned.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: A garantia. Collateral.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What do you want?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You shall become my esclavo. Oh, how I would love for you to wear that Hermia costume for me at night.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Not a bad deal, if I do say so myself.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...All right.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: *Shudder* Hoooh! Yes, what a great deal. Yes, me encanta!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Good for you.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: So your new obra will be unveiled in ten days, yes? May I go see it?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Do as you like.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't have the luxury of choosing my clients.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Ah, how lindo. That open hostility, that fuego in your soul. That erect determination, haah...

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I can't wait to see the fruits of your trabajo. Would you like to stay the night? You are always welcome in this manor of mine with open arms, and legs.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, thank you. Olivia's waiting for me.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You and Olive?! Ah, what a match made in los cielos! Oh, I do want to see... May I?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No. See you at the theatre. And don't come near the stage.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Ah, the tragedy, it is so very triste. Oh no!
I leave the manor with Spencer's moans echoing behind me.
The talks went as well as they could have gone.
I'm stunned at how smoothly it went, actually.
Now all I have to do is write.
But...
The problem is I have no material.
To be honest, I have nothing in my head left that could surpass Hamlet.
As I wrote the play, I felt the boundary between Hamlet and myself crumble.
If I hadn't written it down, perhaps I would have ended up consumed up by my own vengeful thoughts.
The act of writing itself can be a form of salvation for the writer.
Now that I've finished writing it, I can look back and realize that's the truth.
That's why I'm able to keep myself in check as I work to improve the troupe so people can see and hear what I have to say.
All of my hatred for Marlowe...
The sense of loss and impotence...
I mixed it all together in my internal melting pot, and Hamlet came out.
If I want to paint it in a positive light, I could say that I've cleaned out all of those emotions.
But if I want to be negative, I would say that I'm completely empty and out of ideas.
I've come to understand the important points and beats a play must hit upon.
And now I'm familiar with the movements of the actors bringing these characters to life on stage.
I feel that my technique has improved significantly.
I am, by all means, a better writer now than I was a month ago.
Yet now I wonder, what should I even write?
What can I write?
What would make Olivia happy?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will!
As soon as I open the door, Olivia leaps out of the bed and onto me.
I can see the worry clear as day in her eyes.
I smile reassuringly at her.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's fine. Spencer accepted our conditions.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All we have to do is pay the money we promised.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It'll be all right. We just have to focus on the plays.
Olivia heaves a sigh of relief.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I never thought this day would ever come.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm so thankful that you tried to steal a deer that night.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I guess we can thank the deer indirectly.
Olivia smiles, and so do I.
Gazing into her face from up close like this, I feel full of happiness.
But I feel tense at the same time.
This is naught but the starting point.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We're just getting started. We won't achieve true freedom without putting in the work.
Olivia nods.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It'll become much easier if—when we're selected for the court performance.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't know how much the Lily Theater makes, but I don't think any other troupe is raising that much money.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We have work to do.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, but...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: When I'm with you, I feel like we can do anything.
Olivia says, putting a hand to my cheek.
I put my hand over hers and hold it there.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll write.
Her eyes go wide for a moment.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Now?
I nod in response.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Have you decided what the next theme will be?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, actually.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But I feel like I need to be at my desk right now. I don't think I'll be able to sleep for a while yet.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We have a performance tomorrow, remember?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I know. I'll catch a few winks.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You should go to bed though. You're the head of this troupe. You need your sleep.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll be fine, I'm used to this.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I need to write something that can bring tears to the eye of our discerning leader. It's not an easy job.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're the best boy.
Olivia whispers into my ear and plants a kiss on my forehead.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You can write it, I'm certain.
I sit at my desk, and Olivia watches me for a while.
I barely move my quill.
I'm just sitting there, staring at a blank sheet of parchment.
I hear Olivia turn over on the bed a few times and sneak a glance over at her.
She's sleeping soundly.
I can hear her little sighs.
Even while asleep...
...she's as lovely as ever.
I can't help feeling that I'm not man enough to be worth the love of such a magnificent person.
I just learned of her origins, but she's still spent half of her life among nobility.
Even if she made a wrong turn, she would never end up in a run down pub like this one.
Suddenly, I feel terribly distant from her.
Even though we're in the same room.
She's so near, yet seemingly so far out of reach.
I realize that I've always had this feeling in my heart, ever since the day we met.
Although I'm right beside her, I can't quite reach her.
How can I make that into a play?
How can I express this mental wall I feel between us?
I need to turn this into something symbolic, something everyone can sympathize with.
First of all...
Perhaps I should start with the people we saw one another as when we first met.
A love between a young bartender and a beautiful noblewoman.
When the young man sneaks into the mansion, he falls in love with the woman at first sight.
He approaches the woman, as if feeling the pull of destiny itself.
And the two speak of love.
I blush fiercely when I read over what I wrote in the heat of the moment.
It's too obvious and frank.
This is a personal poem meant for the two of us.
It's too embarrassing to even reread it.
I may have gotten a little too sentimental.
I crumple the piece of manuscript and throw it away.
It's no good. There is no way I can surpass Hamlet with such a simple story.
Think, Will, think.
I look at my shelves, recall Rob's rumors, and search through my old notes, but nothing catches my eye.
When dawn starts to break, I go down to the pub and take a short nap.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Everyone, can I have your attention before we begin the rehearsal?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: What is it?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I have good news and bad news, which one do you want to hear first?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Uhhh, how about just the good news?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Agreed.
The rest of the troupe members nod in agreement.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: All right. The good news is that Will finished his new play. We'll start rehearsing today.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: T-Today?!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Huh? We got the second performance today, don't we?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: The Midsummer Night's Dream one!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, but we will be premiering the new one in ten days.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Its title is Hamlet. It's a story about the Danish royal family.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The melancholic, indecisive, shilly-shallying nature of the protagonist is simply the best. Why, it even reminds me of how a certain someone used to be.
Olivia glances my way with a mocking grin.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The leading role, Hamlet, will be mine. As part of my research for the character, I'd like to keep a close eye on a questionable man such as him.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I may not be able to help you there.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, what a tragedy.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will, you will be Ophelia. Hamlet's lover, a girl who goes mad because of Hamlet's thirst for revenge.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Right.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Thomas, you will be Ophelia's father, the Lord Chamberlain Polonius. He's an incompetent man who boasts of his strong prejudice. You can play him as a comical character.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So, just be your usual self.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: That stings!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kiki, you will be Horatio, Hamlet's best friend. It's the role of a man, but the audience wants more of you, so let's keep it androgynous.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You can manage, right? You are the main attraction of A Midsummer Night's Dream. We may still make some adjustments to Puck's lines, so be ready.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh? We're premiering this new play in ten days, right?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We'll perform the new Hamlet for a while, and after that, we'll alternate between A Midsummer Night's Dream and Hamlet.

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: Whaaaa?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Isn't that a bit much?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: We'll all have to perform both, right? My head's gonna burst!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm very sorry about the suddenness of all this. To be honest, I know you all should be focusing on A Midsummer Night's Dream right now.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think that sticking to a single role and getting comfortable in it brings the best out in you as actors.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But we can't afford the luxury of time anymore.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Oh, is this...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: The bad news?
Olivia turns to me, her eyes pleading.
I give her a small nod.
She nods back.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Starting today, this troupe is on its own. Spencer ended his patronage yesterday.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: WHAT?!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: But didn't yesterday go well?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Did the patron dislike something about our performance?
Olivia shakes her head.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Then why?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Actually, are we even allowed to use the theater now?
Olivia looks down, her lips quivering, but says nothing.
Everyone's looking anxiously at her, but the silence only makes the situation more tense.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We withdrew from his patronage. At my request.
Everyone looks at me.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You turned down his support?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: But why?
I search for the right words.
If we become independent before striking success, we'll receive a larger share of our earnings later.
After seeing yesterday's enthusiasm from the crowd, I became certain we could be selected for a court performance.
I want to write new plays without worrying about the patron's stifling conditions.
None of these things would be a lie.
And yet, it wouldn't be the truth either.
I see the worry and unease in the eyes of the other troupe members.
It wouldn't be fair to lie to them.
My father's words come back to me.
Yes, if I start telling white lies, it won't be long before things collapse under the weight of truth.
I can't afford to be a lesser man.
This all started because of me and my impulses.
And I need to see it through.
I have no choice but to do so.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Because I had no choice.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I had no other choice if I wanted to take Olivia away from that man.
Olivia's eyes bulge out and her jaw drops.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Of all the ways you could have worded that...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Ah...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: You mean, take the leader from Spencer?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: But wasn't she his fiancee?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes. I couldn't let Olivia remain under Spencer's thumb for the sake of keeping this troupe afloat.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh? Is that true?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Well...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Wait, so that means...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: You stole both the troupe and his fiancee?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, I went to his manor yesterday and informed him of the change.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: How lily livered!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Ain't much of a damn theft, then!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You know how messed up in the head that man is. We have to do things properly.

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: A-Agreed.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I am aware of the strain my decision puts on all of you. I'd like to apologize, first of all.
I bow my head.
The shock and confusion is apparent in everyone's countenance.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: After you left the pub yesterday, I heard that you were all receiving a monthly payment from Olivia.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Taking those expenses into account, this is the only way to keep using the Globe without Spencer's help until we're selected for the court performance.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: So a new play in ten days.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And a second one after that.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Excuse moi?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: What? You have another script?! Can you really write all that, Will?!
Everyone turns back to me, clearly astonished.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think he's already written it. Isn't that right, Will?
Olivia quirks an impish smile and glances at me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It looks like we'll have a love story on our hands.
I snap my head back to her.
She's smirking mischievously.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It can't be. How?! When?!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You dropped it on the floor of your room. How could I not see it?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No! That was a reject!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Is that so? I didn't think it was that bad.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh? What was it about?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It looked like the story of how a young bartender falls in love with a beautiful noblewoman.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Whoaaa...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Isn't that a bit too obvious? Rein yourself in a little, lover boy.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's what I'm trying to do! Wait, no! I'm telling you it's a reject!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh? Really?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Bah, who cares? It sounds easy to follow.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Hamlet has a lot of complex characterization, so I think a simple love story would be good.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Go with that story.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Understood?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I guess I can give it a shot.
Olivia nods and turns to the troupe.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Everyone, our situation has changed considerably. I understand that this will be hard to accept for some of you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But while it was Will's decision, I approved his judgment.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: He helped me, and I don't regret it. That's the truth.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I am terribly sorry to tell you all after the fact like this.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'd like all of you to help us make this happen. I understand if you don't want to subject yourselves to these conditions, though. I leave the decision to you.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Decision, you say?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Not like we have much else going on if we give up the ghost here.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, right!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The fact that we lost our patron will become common knowledge soon enough.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You'll all be treated as vagrants. Are you okay with that?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: How is that any different from being our leader's slaves?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I mean, if it ever gets out that the leader is a woman who's acting on stage, we'll all be thrown behind bars all the same.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: If there ever was something to be afraid of, it isn't what others say about us.
Thomas says, tracing a straight line across his neck with his thumb.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, you're right.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, but never mind that.
Kiki and Thomas exchange glances and giggle.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You stole Spencer's fiancee! That's the best news ever!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: You put our whole career to shame, lad!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I'm having the best time of my life, so I don't care if people want to call us vagrants.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: It would actually make for a good excuse to pick up thievery again.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't be stupid! If anyone gets careless, it'll spell the end for the troupe. As long as we're here, you don't give up your pride as an actor.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Hahah!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Now that's more like it. Stay strong, leader.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: It's all fine. Let's do our best!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Being chosen for the court performance without a patron would be a first in history!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Vagrants entering the Royal Palace? Now, that would be damn well impressive!
My eyes meet Olivia's.
The tension we had been feeling all morning comes loose, and we laugh together.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Guess they're all a bunch of rejects. You did well bringing all these people together, eh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't talk as though you're not included. You're part of this too.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And you too.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm well aware.
Olivia blows out a breath and ties up her long hair into a ponytail.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Get ready to rehearse! First, we're gonna improve on yesterday's performance! Then we're gonna start practicing the new play! Get your scripts!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We have no time to lose! I don't want to see any tomfoolery here, understood?!

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: Aye, ma'am!
For our second performance, the theater is clearly more packed than yesterday.
Just as we expected, everyone flooded the theater after hearing about Kiki.
The more attention Kiki commands, the easier it'll be to hide Olivia's gender.
If everyone's too focused on Kiki, we can hide the real woman of the group.
And after that, the story is what will draw the attention of the audience.
By putting it all out there, we can camouflage our biggest secret. It's our best and only shot.
We increased the amount of food and drink in the theater so it doesn't sell out immediately like it did yesterday.
Olivia bought the ale from our pub.
It compensates for the fewer hours the pub stays open because of our new tight schedule.
We have a full house once again.
But as things stand now, this is the bare minimum we need to keep afloat.
How long can we keep this going?
Everything depends on the answer to that question.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I wonder how many of the people that came yesterday are here today?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Do you remember any of them, Will?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's not like I go around memorizing every single face I see.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Mmh, about thirty percent of them are repeaters, I'd say.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Really? How do you know?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Everyone started chanting when I came on in the second act yesterday, remember?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: They were all staring directly at me and shouting 'We don't care if he's a guy!'

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I figured they would.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You did? Are you sure this is okay?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: And I think about thirty per cent of the audience today are chanting in time like yesterday. The rest are a little off tempo, so I suppose they must be new.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's assume the rate of regulars we get will be around thirty percent, then.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Did everyone manage to fit into the theater today?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: No, we had to turn away a fair amount of people.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What a waste.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: There's a lot of space between the seats on the second and third floors, right? Can't we put more seats in there? The third floor looks especially empty even when it's full.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's the area for nobles only. The price between first floor admission and third floor is completely different.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, but it's still too much space. If we earn ourselves a good reputation, those pompous nobles will come even if they have to sit a little closer to each other.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, I suppose you have a point. They tend to be afraid of not being up to date with the latest trends.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Okay, then let's put the same amount of seats we have on the second floor and try to encourage more nobles to come.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And how about we also increase the amount of seats on the second floor and offer discounts to the people coming again so they can enter for a little cheaper?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If we can expect thirty percent to come back, I think it wouldn't hurt to give them incentive and a new angle to watch the play from. That'll keep them hooked.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That way people have a reason to come again, and even discounted, the price to enter the second floor will be better for us than cramming them all into the first floor.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That might be a good idea, actually. Let's hand out fliers to the audience members on the first floor starting tomorrow.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We can write down the date on them, and they can use them to enter the second floor at a discount price from that day onwards. Can we make it happen by tomorrow?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Let's get our drinking buddies to help!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yeah, it's only fair since they have to put up with us constantly complaining about rehearsals.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You didn't need to mention that.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Okay, I'll leave the design up to you. Why not draw Kiki's face on them?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Nice idea!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: So, like this?
Thomas draws a little sketch of Kiki on his script.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's really good!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You captured my cuteness very well!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Way to toot your own horn.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It is really good, though. You're quite skilled at drawing, Thomas.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: I used to sell paintings a lifetime ago. I could even pass as a famous painter if the noble I was talking to was dumb enough.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Ahahahah! Now that brings back memories!
