texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's incredible. Why, I want to make a collection out of these. Can you draw a different pose each day?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Like so?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Incredible!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Oh, I look so adorable!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Haven't we gone through this before?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Anyway, it's pretty good!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: I used to sell paintings a lifetime ago.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And you even passed for a famous painter in front of dumb nobles, we know. I'll shut your mouth permanently if you keep repeating the same story over and over.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The praise was short-lived, huh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: I'll get these ready in a flash as soon as I can gather up all my painting swindler buddies from back in the day. These doodles are easy enough.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: They're so fast at drawing that you can barely see their quills!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: It's good motivation when it feels like you're drawing pennies into your pouch, hahah!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I will pay you all from a portion of the ticket sales. Do make them see the advantages of earning a wage through normal means rather than putting their necks on the line selling forgeries.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That way we'll get the second floor packed, and they'll see more money.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: I'm glad our mighty leader understands how the mind of a swindler works.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't underestimate me. You are not the only ones with experience in the field.
Thomas and Kiki exchange glances.
I can't help but smile at the scene.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're writing the new play, right, Will?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Let me help you. You didn't make much progress yesterday, did you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You were watching me?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I was, all the way until morning.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You're writing together?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Your very own love story?

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: How spicy!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why yes, I do wish it would be, but I've never met a denser man in my life. Talk about a late bloomer.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Can you believe he didn't even try to lay a hand on me over the whole night? I do feel like I understand how Hermia must have felt.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Let's go, Will. We have only ten days until it's time for the new play.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Y-Yeah.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: It's gonna happen, huh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: They're getting no sleep.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Actually, I don't think it can NOT happen, from the looks of it.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yeah, that's the kind of woman that just gets grumpier until she gets her way.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You don't seem like you'd be good at ad libbing, so I hope you've got some sappy lines ready!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: I bet you can talk the talk, but can you grope that arse?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I-I've had enough of you two!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Shut it already! I-I... Just shut up!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You pair of dolts!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Truly, what a waste of good looks.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: There's a point where the naivete becomes a turn off, lad!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Man up and get HER show on the road!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Not even I'm a virgin, lad! You gotta get that taken care of!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ah, get off my back!
You gotta be jesting.
Even Thomas has more experience than me?
After getting back home, we open the pub for a short while.
We told the regulars that we'd be reducing our business hours, so they all come in droves when we're finally open.
After the short rush hour, we close the pub and go upstairs to write in my room.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What exactly are you stuck on?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Up until now, I based all my stories off things people told me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But this is all me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Obviously, I'm the young bartender, and the noblewoman is you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, I didn't notice.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How funny. It's a little too close to home, so it's kind of hard to write about it.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I see, but I don't think you should do away with that personal quality. The only thing to touch the audience's hearts are the lines that come directly from your own.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You realized that while writing Hamlet, didn't you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: If you get all shy because you feel the setting of the story overlaps too much with your real life, it'll only become noise for the audience.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So how about you change the setting to something you can look at a little more objectively?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: For example?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What if there was an obstacle to their love?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: There are many things in the world of nobles other than social status that could do that.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oftentimes, a woman's future husband is decided by her parents, or sometimes two noble houses are on bad terms.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Houses on bad terms?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, there are plenty of families with feuds between them.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I think I've heard of such a thing before...
Feuds between families.
I follow the trail of my memory.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...in Italy.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Italy again? Another story from Rob?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, I read about it in a book. The title was, if I remember well...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: 'The Tragical History of Romeus and Juliet.'

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Romeus and Juliet?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes. The man was selling translations of Italian novels, and he told me that one story.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The story was...
It was set in a certain region in Italy.
A story about two families with an age-old vendetta.
The son of one family and the daughter of the other fall deeply in love and marry behind their parents' backs.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But in the end, they both die.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's quite a simple tragic story, isn't it?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But before they reach that tragic end, it is certainly a story about the love of two young dreamers.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think it's good. How about you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, we only have ten days. We use this story as a base to build my own words upon.
I raise my head.
Olivia is looking down at me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll write this story.
She quirks a pleasant smile.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Good boy.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Can you read out this line for me?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Sure, which one?
Romeus or Juliet?
After thinking for a moment, I look up at her.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Juliet's lines, thank you.
Olivia nods and takes the manuscript from me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So this is the scene where their love begins. I'm on the balcony right now, yes?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And I'm below, looking up at you.
Juliet is talking to herself, unaware of Romeus' presence.
They have already begun to feel love for each other.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: O Romeus, Romeus! Wherefore art thou, Romeus?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What's in a name? That which we call a rose, by any other name would smell as sweet! So Romeus would, were he not Romeus call'd.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Wait a moment, this is hard to say.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: O Romeus, Romeus! Wherefore art thou, Romeus?
Olivia stops and sounds out the words.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The name is too long. We need something shorter if I'm to repeat it this much. Change it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Wouldn't 'Will' work just fine? O Will, Will! Wherefore art thou, Will?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you jesting?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Of course.
Olivia frowns and furrows her eyebrows in annoyance.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Hurry up.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How about, uh, Romeo?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Romeo... Romeo, Romeo! Wherefore art thou, Romeo?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes, that's good. Let's go from the top again.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: O Romeo, deny thy father and refuse thy name. If thou wilt not, be but sworn my love, and I'll no longer be a Capulet.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I take thee at thy word. Call me but love, and I'll be new baptized. Henceforth I will never be Romeo. By yonder blessed moon I swear.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: O, swear not by the moon.
Olivia answers with a line that isn't in the script.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Not by the moon, the inconstant moon. That monthly changes in her circled orb, lest that thy love prove likewise variable.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia, that—

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Juliet.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Although I joy in thee, I have no joy of this contract to-night. It is too rash, too unadvised, too sudden.
The moonlight illuminates the room.
Olivia's not reading from the script anymore.
She turns her eyes to me, a mixture of anxiousness and longing swirling in them.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: At our feet lie years of bloodshed and enmity. Thy love, like a flash in the darkest of nights...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It is too like the lightning, which doth cease to be.
Pure passion laces her gaze.
Her rose eyes gleam with a mysterious, beautiful glow, and I find myself unable to tear myself from them.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Do not swear at all, or, if thou wilt, swear by thy gracious self.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Swear by thyself, which is the god of my idolatry, and I'll believe thee.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Swear not by the moon, but by thyself.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Swear to me.
Her eyes seem to glimmer.
They shine with a pure brilliance, like a bright fire seen through a veil of water.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I swear.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: By my heart's dear love, I swear. For it is my soul that calls upon thy name, and without it would certainly wilt.
The script slips out of my hands.
The words spring forth from the depths of my soul.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: To live without thy love would be the same as death.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Certainly, I would rather sack this hateful anatomy of mine, were my world be one without your love.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Therefore...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: By my life, I swear eternal love to thee.
Juliet...
No, Olivia looks into my eyes and smiles.
The soft moonlight shines through the window, playing across her hair and lips.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Good night, good night, my Romeo. Parting is such a sweet sorrow, that I shall say good-night till it be morrow.
The silence slowly melts away her sweet smile.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So, what now?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Oh, uh, right.
I look down at the script by my feet.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Their first...
Olivia nods slowly.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...kiss.
A meaningful smile comes back to her face.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't cut corners. Keep going.
Step by step, Olivia approaches me.
She stops in front of me and looks up at me, her eyes flickering with that same gentle fire.
Wordlessly, I draw her into my embrace.
Her hips are slender, and her whole body feels supple and soft to the touch.
Her eyes are right in front of me.
They're moist with tears and full of earnest desire.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Is it Romeo about to kiss me?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Or is it you, Will?
A sweet sigh escapes her lips and flutters across mine.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you Juliet? Or—

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm Olivia.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Then...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm Will.
She gently cups my cheeks in her hands, and we kiss.
The warmth and the texture of her lips on mine stuns me for a second.
I pull her even closer to me.
Olivia leans into me, accepting the embrace.
Our bodies come together in the most intimate of ways.
Her scent fills my lungs.
My senses are overloaded by her sensations. All I can feel is love.
Her faint sighs are loud in my ears.
We share a deep, passionate kiss for what feels like a lifetime.
When I try to pull back a little, Olivia slides her hand to the back of my head and pulls me in.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't stop.
The tone that leaves her lips is something I've never heard before.
From the small space between her lips, her saliva mingles with my own.
Her taste spreads all across my tongue.
Slowly, we part the kiss.
Then, Olivia gently wraps her arms around my neck, her long sleeves riding up her arms.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will...
Her eyes are alight with desire.
And her fiery gaze is set upon me, licking at my very soul.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's not over yet, right?
I answer with a nod.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't know how good I may be at this, though.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So long as it's with you, I'm happy.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No matter how clumsy or inexperienced you are.
Olivia snuggles up to me and whispers into my ear.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Make love to me. Just let it happen.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'll allow you to be poor at it, just for tonight.
After that, she pulls back a little.
She looks up at me again, a sweet smile crossing her face.
Under the moonlight, she undresses, stripping her clothes off one piece at a time.
Strangely enough, I feel no tension.
I take her in my arms and gently lay her down on the bed.
Until dawn, Olivia and I explore and love each other like never before.
